recipes.name: Roasted Tomato Soup
instructions: Cut tomatoes place on a baking tray sprinkle salt and pepper, cloves of garlic, sliced onions, rosemary, thyme and oil on top of the tomatoes.
Bake for 15 minutes for 60 C.
Take a blender, put the roasted ingredients in the blender and blend to a fine texture.
Pour the blended puree into a saucepan and cook on a medium flame.
Serve hot with croutons.

recipes.name: Mexican Meatball Soup
instructions: For Meatballs: Mix egg, salt, black pepper, garlic, red chili into ground beef and mix. Shape into small meatballs.
Heat little oil in pan and half fry meat balls. Set aside.
For Soup: Heat butter and fry onion until translucent. Then add water, stock, tomato sauce, tomato paste, lemon juice, salt and black pepper and stir until the tomato paste has been incorporated.
Slow down to simmer. After 5 minutes add meatballs and cook until meatballs are completely cook.
Garnish with mint leaves and serve with flat bread.

recipes.name: Chinese Soup
instructions: Make a chicken stock in a large saucepan with water, ginger and spring onion. There's no need to peel or chop the ginger and spring onions
Bring to the boil, skimming off any scum, then cover and simmer for 1 hour. Strain the stock and discard the ginger and spring onions.
While the stock is simmering, rinse the mushrooms then discard the tough stalks and cut the mushroom caps into thin slices.
Heat the sesame oil in a large saucepan, add chicken and ginger and cook for 30 seconds, stirring.

Add it in stock now, bring to the boil and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the spring onions, shrimps or prawns, soya sauce, fish sauce, salt and pepper, lemon juice. Bring back to the boil, and then add the noodles and simmer for 2–3 minutes or until softened.
Sprinkle with coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Rasam (South Indian soup)
instructions: First prepare the Rasam powder.
Roast the ingredients on low flame.
Let it cool down. Grind to fine powder.
Soak tamarind in water for 15 minutes, get the pulp 1 cup water.
Cook the lentils in 2 cup of water, till it is soft.
Take deep cooking pot, add 1 cup water, and add rasam powder and tamarind water.
Mash the cooked lentils, add to the mixture and boil for 5 minutes. Add salt and more water if needed. Boil further for 5 minutes.
Take a frying pan, pour 1 table spoon oil and heat it.
Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds, when they stop cracking add asafetida and turmeric powder, curry leaves. Add to ready Rasam and cover the pot.
Rasam is ready. Serve with hot steamed rice.

recipes.name: Asian Noodle Soup
ingredients: Jalapeno seeds removed and thinly sliced, 1/2
Vegetable broth (preferably one without tomatoes) 6 cups
Green onions 3 plus extra for serving, sliced
Carrot 1, peeled and sliced into very thin coins
instructions: In a large pot, heat sesame oil over medium high heat. Once hot, add ginger and garlic and saute until fragrant, 2-3 minutes. Add jalapeno, vegetable broth, and green onions. Cover and simmer 10-15 minutes.
While broth is simmering, cook noodles. Drain and set aside.

Strain broth into a large bowl. Once strained, pour broth back into pot. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, vegetables, and tofu, and simmer until veggies are heated through, 1-2 minutes. Add noodles and heat for 1 more minute, until both noodles and broth are hot.
Remove soup from heat. Serve alongside sliced green onions, chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Thai Coconut Shrimp Soup
instructions: In a large pot over medium heat, add the olive oil, garlic, ginger and lemongrass. Give it a stir, then
Add the curry powder, crushed red pepper flakes and the broth. Increase the heat to medium-high bringing the broth to a light boil.

Add the shrimp and reduce the heat to medium. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the coconut milk and cabbage. Increase the heat just a bit and as soon as the soup comes to another very light simmer, remove it from the heat.
Season with salt to taste. Serve in bowls and top with a squeeze of lime and some parsley, additional crushed red pepper if you'd like.

recipes.name: Salmon Chowder
ingredients: Fresh dill sprigs and/or cracked black pepper (optional)
instructions: To poach fresh salmon, in a large pan, bring water to boiling. Add salmon. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 6 to 8 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork. Remove salmon from pan, discarding poaching liquid. Flake salmon into 1/2-inch pieces; set aside.

Meanwhile, in a cast iron or ceramic or clay pan, combine vegetable broth, onions, potato, snipped fresh dill, lemon zest, salt and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.

Combine milk and corn-starch. Mix well; stir into soup. Stir in asparagus. Cook and stir until slightly thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Gently stir in poached salmon; heat through. If you like, garnish with fresh dill sprigs and/or cracked pepper.

recipes.name: Minestrone Soup
ingredients: red kidney beans1 can , drained and rinsed
great northern beans1 can , drained and rinsed
Finely shredded Parmesan cheese, for serving
instructions: Add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato pesto, parmesan rind, vegetable stock, water, carrots, celery, onions, garlic, oregano, rosemary, and bay leaves to a slow cooker. Season it salt and pepper to taste and cook on low heat 2 hours or high 1 hours.

Add in red kidney beans, great northern beans, zucchini, and pasta and cook on high heat for an additional 20 - 25 minutes until pasta is tender. Stir in the spinach and green beans and cook for an additional 5 minutes until heated through. Serve warm topped with parmesan cheese and garlic toasts.

recipes.name: Spiced Carrot and Lentil Soup
ingredients: plain yogurt and naan bread, to serve
instructions: Heat a large saucepan and dry-fry the cumin seeds and chilli flakes for 1 min. Scoop out about half of the seeds with a spoon and set aside. Add the oil, carrot, lentils, stock and milk to the pan and bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 mins until the lentils have swollen and softened.

Whizz the soup with a stick blender or in a food processor until smooth (or leave it chunky if you prefer). Season to taste and finish with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkling of the reserved toasted spices. Serve with warmed naan breads.

recipes.name: Mulligatawny Soup
ingredients: chicken breasts 2, cubed very small and cooked
instructions: Saute the onion and shredded carrots in the butter in a large pot. Add flour and curry and cook five more minutes. Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce to a simmer for about 30 minutes. While simmering, add chicken, apple, rice, raisins, thyme, salt, and pepper to the soup.
Simmer for 20 more minutes until the rice is done. When there is about 2 minutes left, stir in the cream.

recipes.name: Chicken Croquettes
instructions: Heat some oil in a pan.
Saute fry onions in it and then add minced meat.
Add salt, white pepper and mix well.
Cook them well and then put aside to let it cool.
Mash the potatoes and add chicken mixture in it.
Mix them all well and make small round shapes.
Beat the eggs well.
Roll them in plain flour, then in eggs, then in bread crumbs.
Deep fry them all.
Serve with ketchup or any other dip.

recipes.name: Falafel
instructions: Boil and grind grams.
Put garlic cloves, parsley, coriander leaves, green chillies, flour, soda, cumin seed, whole coriander, salt and black pepper.
Mix all spices and grind grams more.
Now make pattie/kabab of this mixture.
Heat oil and fry falafal is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Drum Sticks
instructions: Steam chicken drum sticks in steamer for about 12 to 10 minutes.
Now in a bowl mash potatoes.
In potatoes put rice, chilli flakes, ginger garlic paste, black pepper, cumin seed, coriander seed, coriander leaves and salt mix well.
Now coat this potato mixture on chicken drum sticks.
Dip these coated sticks in beaten egg then roll into crumbs.
Deep fry in oil.
Drum Sticks are ready to serve with sauce or ketchup.

recipes.name: Potato Samosa
instructions: In flour put salt, ghee and water knead dough.
Make small balls and flatten.
Roll it with rolling pin and make roti.
For filling: Mash potatoes in a bowl.
Put salt, coriander seed, cumin seed and red chilli powder mix well.
Now fill this mixture and give samosa shape.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry on low flame.
Serve hot with yogurt/curd chutney.

recipes.name: Fish Cutlets
ingredients: Surmai fish (cut into finger size pieces) 1/2 kg
Bread crumbs, mixed with a little chat masala
instructions: Marinate the fish in the marinade for 1 hr.
Dip pieces of fish in the batter, roll in bread crumbs and chat masala mixture.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden and serve with chutney.

recipes.name: Chicken on Toast
instructions: Mix mince, onions, green chilies, garlic paste, flour, salt, white pepper, egg and baking powder. Mix altogether very well.
Spread this mixture over each bread slice and deep fry in hot oil for 5 minute.
Drain out the slices, cut in square shape and deep fry again for 2 minute till golden brown.

recipes.name: Spring Rolls
instructions: Soak rice noodles for 15 minutes (they do not require boiling).
Heat sesame seeds oil in a wok.
Add rice noodles, bamboo shoots, cabbage, spring onions, salt, black pepper powder, soya sauce, bean sprouts and 1 egg.
Stir fry for 1-2 minutes.
Put off the flame; place all ingredients at one end of samosa strips.
Fold them and close the edges with beaten egg, then deep fry till golden brown.
Take them out on paper towel.
Serve delicious, hot, crispy Spring Rolls with ketchup.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Cutlets
instructions: Combine together spaghetti, potatoes, chicken, cheddar cheese, sweet corn, salt, black pepper, coriander leaves and green chillies, mix well.
Form the mixture into small cutlets.
Dip in beaten egg, roll in bread crumbs.
Shallow fry in frying pan until golden brown.
Garnish with lemon, onion and tomato slices.
Serve with chutney

recipes.name: Pizza Roll
instructions: Method for preparing chicken: In a bowl add barbeque sauce, garlic paste, lemon juice, red chilli powder and salt.
Mix well, add the chicken pieces.
Heat oil in pan and fry the chicken pieces till it turns golden brown.
Turn the flame off.
Method for making Dough: Add yeast in lukewarm water along with sugar.
Leave a side for 15 minutes till it rises.
Now add white flour, salt and baking powder.
Knead until smooth dough is formed.
Cover with a plastic sheet and leave a side in a warm place for 3-4 hours, until the dough rises.
Knead the dough again until a uniform consistency is reached.
Dough is ready.
Method for making pizza roll: Preheat oven at 200 degree C
Make small round balls with the dough and roll them with a rolling pin.
Spread the sauce onto the base of each flattened dough.
Add chopped capsicum, chopped tomatoes, sliced mushrooms and chicken pieces.
Roll each dough and bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes.
Delicious pizza roll is ready to serve, enjoy!

recipes.name: Chilli Fries
instructions: Heat oil in a frying pan, add 2tbsp chopped onions and sauté for 2 minutes
Add garlic paste with mince, and fry for 2 minutes.
Add all seasonings with ½ cup water.
Cover and cook till mince is tender.
In a wok deep fry potato fingers till they turn crisp and light golden in colour.
To serve: In a platter spread fries topped with mince.
Then pour cream cheese and sliced jalapeños topped with parsley and green onions.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Quesadillas
instructions: Mix salsa and cream cheese in a dish and place aside.
For tortillas, knead flour, backing powder and salt with luke warm water.
Mix green onion, tomato, capsicum and jalapeno pepper in a separate bowl.
Make tortillas with this dough and spread at some surface.
Place some mixture of salsa and cream cheese over it.
Place filling mixture over it too and cheddar cheese on the top.
Join one corner of tortillas with the other one so that the mixture remains inside it.
Fix the corners with the help of knife of fork by pressing them with it.
Heat up oil in pan and fry Quesadillas for two minutes by both sides till cheese melts.
Cut them from the middle and serve.

recipes.name: Mozzarella Cheese Sticks
ingredients: 1/2 Kg mozzarella cheese (cut into sticks roughly 3-4 inches long and 1/2 inch wide)
instructions: Spoon flour into a bowl; set aside.
In another shallow bowl, mix together bread crumbs, chili powder, and garlic salt.
Beat eggs in a third bowl.
Prepare cheese sticks by first dredging them in the flour, one at a time, turning to coat evenly.
Dip cheese sticks in egg mixture, and then coat with the bread crumb mixture.
Dip again in the eggs, and once more in the bread crumbs.
Set on waxed paper and continue until all of the cheese sticks are coated.
In deep frying pan add oil and heat it on medium flame.
Using tongs, gently place cheese sticks into the hot oil and fry for about 30 seconds, or until golden brown.
Do not overcook, as the breading will burn quite quickly.
Remove mozzarella sticks from the oil and set on paper towels to drain.
Serve immediately with any dipping sauce or tomato ketchup.

recipes.name: Prawn Tempura
instructions: Wash, and de-vein the prawns, but leaves the tail on.
Put corn flour, wheat flour, soda water, beaten egg, breadcrumbs, and salt in a bowl to make a thick paste.
Add prawns to this mixture and leave them for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in wok.
Put prawns in the wok one by one.
When the prawns start turning golden, take them out on a dish and serve.

recipes.name: Sesame Crispy Fried Wings
instructions: Mix chilli sauce, soy sauce, salt and black pepper.
Also add in cornflour and sesame seeds.
Now dip the wings in this batter and then leave to marinate.
Then deep fry them in oil.

recipes.name: Batata Wada
instructions: Boil, peel and mash potatoes in small bites.
Mix ginger, garlic and green chillies together in to a blender and grind coarsely.
Heat up oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, hing, curry leaf and coarse ginger garlic paste. Sauté until it gets light golden colour.
Add turmeric powder, mashed potatoes and mix well.
Add salt, lemon juice and coriander leaves and mix well.
For Batter: Take besan, to that add rice flour, turmeric powder, chilli powder, baking soda, salt to taste and mix well.
Add water slowly and make it in to little thick consistency batter.
For Vada: Make small balls from potato mixture, deep in to chickpea batter and deep fry until it gets deep golden color from all the sides.
Serve hot with pav and garnish with some peanut chutney, tamarind or mint chutney.

recipes.name: Russian Salad
instructions: Boil potatoes and carrots.
Cut apple, potato and carrot into cubes.
Combine boiled carrot, boiled potatoes, apple, walnut, raisin, black pepper, mayonnaise and cream in a bowl and mix well.
Serve the delicious Russian salad with grilled chicken and zeera pulao.
To serve, garnish with lettuce leaf, sliced cucumber and long slices of carrot.
Tips: Boiled green peas or boiled chicken can also be added to the salad.

recipes.name: Turkish Couscous Salad
instructions: In a large bowl put couscous add salt, paprika, cumin powder and mix well with spoon.
Add boiling water that covers the couscous stir spoon to incorporate, cover and leave for 10 minutes.
Mix with fork and add onion, tomato, cucumber, red chili, olive oil, coriander, mint, parsley, black pepper, lemon juice and zest mix all ready to serve.

recipes.name: Orange Chicken Salad
instructions: Cut oranges into half and scoop out segments carefully so segments do not get mushy keep a side orange's both shell.
Cut fine chunks of orange segments and combine all ingredients in a large bowl except leaves.
Arrange spinach and lettuce on two plates and put orange shells on the centre of both plates like a bowl.
Fill orange shells with salad sprinkle grated cheese and freshly ground black pepper

recipes.name: Blueberry Orange and Spinach Salad
instructions: Line baking tray with parchment paper now lay foil paper on tray.
In a bowl mix pecans and syrup well and spread coated pecans on the foil and sprinkle ½ tsp of sugar on pecans and now bake till 7 minutes or roast well. Remove and let them cool completely.
For Salad Dressing: In a bowl add vinegar, oil, orange juice and 1 tbsp of sugar whisk all till creamy dressing is ready. Set aside.
In a serving large bowl put orange, blueberries and spinach pour over dressing and toss well sprinkle roasted pecans and serve.

recipes.name: Winter Crunch Salad
instructions: Cut apple into thin wedges, trim radish and cut in quartered also separate chicory into leaves.
In a large bowl toss celery, nuts, radish, apples and chicory.

Take half of garlic bread and make slices of it keep a side and make small chunks of remaining bread and add into salad bowl top with cheese chunks pour dressing and honey toss well to incorporate well.
Ready for serve with garlic bread slices.

recipes.name: Layered Salad
instructions: Cut potato, carrot and egg in cube shape.
In a bowl first set layer of boiled potato, then chicken; add some mayonnaise and sprinkle black pepper.
Now layer eggs, mayonnaise, carrot and cover with thin layer of mayonnaise.
Chill in fridge and turn over salad on plate and serve or serve as it is in the bowl.

recipes.name: Cucumber & Peanut Fantasy Salad
instructions: Peel and cut cucumber into tiny square pieces.
Take a large bowl add cucumber and peanuts.
Add seasonings mix well and serve.

recipes.name: American Corn Salad
ingredients: Capsicum chopped into tiny cubes ½ cup
Tomatoes chopped into tiny cubes ½ cup
Cucumber chopped in tiny cubes 1 cup
instructions: Mix everything together (sweet corn, spring onion cup, capsicum chopped, tomatoes, cucumber, mayonnaise, salt, white pepper and sugar) in a bowl.

recipes.name: Pasta Chicken Salad
instructions: In a bowl add chicken breast, macaroni, capsicum, sweet corn, tomato puree, ketchup, chili sauce, sugar, salt, cream and mayonnaise. Mix well.
Serve over bed of salad leaves, serve chilled.

recipes.name: Tomato, Basil and Feta Salad
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl toss together the tomatoes, cucumber, green onions, basil, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and feta cheese.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.name: Mojito Salad
instructions: Cook sugar and water over low heat until sugar dissolve.
Stir in lime juice.
Drop mixture over fresh fruits and toss gently until fruit is lightly coated.
Sprinkle mint, toss again and serve.

recipes.name: Prawn Salsa
instructions: Finely chop capsicum, tomatoes, garlic, onion, green chilies and cucumber.
Heat oil in a wok, add in chopped garlic.
Sauté till golden brown.
Now add all the chopped vegetables, corn, lemon juice, coriander leaves, black pepper powder and salt.
Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
Lastly add boiled chopped prawns and mix well.
Dish it out and serve.

recipes.name: Yogurt Egg Salad
instructions: Cut boiled eggs into two halves and scoop out yolks.
Mash the yolk with yogurt and all other ingredients till gets creamy.
Fill this mixture into boiled egg whites with piping bag or directly.
In a bowl add macaroni, yogurt, chopped tomatoes, cucumber, capsicum, lemon juice, salt and black pepper together.
Place this mixture in the center of a serving dish.
Set egg white filled with beaten yolk and enjoy delicious healthy salad.

recipes.name: Summer Salad
instructions: Finely chop radish, green capsicum, red capsicum, green capsicum, ice berg, tomato, cucumber and parsley.
Now in a bowl mix all the chopped vegetables with boiled red and white beans.
Also chop potatoes into small cubes, add to salad mixture and mix well.
Finely chop and an apple and mix to the salad.
Separately mix together mayonnaise, fresh cream, mustard paste and lemon juice. Mix well.
Lastly in a large bowl put together all the chopped vegetables, salt, black pepper and prepared dressing. Mix all well.
Dish it out, serve chilled.

recipes.name: Cashew Chicken Mango Salad
instructions: Brush both side of chicken with virgin oil, salt and pepper
Then fry chicken for 4 to 5 minutes over a medium heat.
Remove from the heat and let it cool slightly.
Then cut chicken into the small pieces.
For Dressing: Mix lime juice, honey salt and pepper in bowl and steam in 2 tsp olive oil.
Then divide the lettuce in plates and top with cooked chicken, mangoes, avocados and 2 tsp cashews in each plate and drizzle with the dressing.
Delicious and mouth-watering cashew chicken salad is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Chipotle-Mango BBQ Chicken Salad
instructions: For the Sauce: Mix mango, chipotle pepper, adobo sauce, ketchup, apple juice, onion, garlic, lemon juice, unseasoned rice vinegar, brown sugar, canola oil, paprika, salt, black pepper into saucepan and boil over a medium heat for 15-20 minutes. Let it cool then put into blender and process until smooth.
For Dressing: Mix prepared sauce, plain Greek yogurt. Then taste it and add more lime juice, salt and pepper if necessary.

For the Salad: Marinate chicken breast into prepared sauce for at least 15 minutes or up to 3 hours. Then grill it over a medium-high heat for 5-6 minutes per side. Before slicing, remove it from the grill at least for 5 minutes. Grill corn along with the chicken, turn it every few minutes until cooked on all sides. Let it cool for a few minutes, and then slice kernels off the cob.
Divide lettuce into plates, and then top with the grilled corn, tomatoes, cilantro and chicken. Drizzle with prepared dressing.
Ready to serve.

recipes.name: Green Mango Salad
instructions: Soak mango in a bowl of ice water to make it crisp.
Using a mortar and pestle pound the dry shrimp along with the peanuts, red chili and coriander.
Add the fish sauce, lemon juice, sweet chili sauce and sugar and combine.
On a serving platter place the drained mango and toss along with the green onion pour over the mixture of all the spices and toss well.
Serve with lemon wedges and garnish with fresh coriander.

recipes.name: Chicken Minced Salad
instructions: Roast whole red chilies and crush.
In a pan, heat olive oil and add garlic paste and chicken mince and sauté briefly.
When water begins to dry up and chicken looks tender, take it off the flame.
In a mixing bowl, add mincemeat, crushed and roasted red chilies, fish sauce, chopped spring onion, chopped coriander, chopped mint and lemon juice and mix well.
Now add roasted rice and mix.
Garnish with cabbage and cucumber and serve.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Pasta Salad
instructions: In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente.
Drain, place in a large bowl and set aside.
To make the dressing mix together tomato, ketchup, brown vinegar, brown sugar, salad oil and salt.
Place the drained pasta in a large bowl.
Finely slice cucumber, carrot and capsicum.
Mix with the pasta along with the pineapple chunks.
Pour the dressing over the pasta.
Add lemon juice, black pepper, salt and chopped parsley.
Gently mix the salad cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Before serving garnish with stir fried almonds.

recipes.name: Mexican Bean Salad
ingredients: Haricot Beans or cannellini beans 1 can
instructions: Drain the beans and corn well and set aside in bowl.
Chop the onion, green chili, red pepper and tomato into 1 cm cubes. Mix with the beans.
And season lightly with salt and pepper.
To make the dressing beat the oil, lime juice, zest of 1 lime, oregano and salt and pepper and sugar until well combined.
Pour over salad toss well to combine and allow it to sit for 15 to 20 minutes
Now before serving, garnish with coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Mustard Chicken Curry
instructions: In a pan heat oil and fry the chopped onions.

Then add ginger paste with garlic paste then add chicken and cook until chicken changes the colour. Now add finely chopped capsicum, curry powder, black pepper and cumin in a same pan for 1 to 2 minutes.
Then add vinegar, water as required and cup mustard paste.
Cook the mixture until it boils.
After this add cream and fry it on a low flame for 4 to 5 minutes and garnish with chopped coriander and serve it.

recipes.name: Chicken Kalya-E-Khas
instructions: Grind together green chilies, almonds and coconut.
Marinate chicken with grinded mixture, fried onion, tomato puree, yogurt, lemon juice, salt, chili powder and ginger garlic paste leave it for 1 hour.
Heat oil add marinated chicken with marination.
Cook till chicken tender and oil comes on top.
Garnish with chopped coriander.
Serve with naan.

recipes.name: Chicken Pineapple Curry
instructions: Wash the chicken and cut into 10 pieces.
Heat the oil in a wok and fry the onion light brown.
Add the chicken and stir-fry for 2 minutes add ginger, turmeric, chili powder, coriander and remaining spices, let it cook till chicken is tenders.
Add the pineapple green chilies, sugar and salt.
Keep over moderate heat.
Stir from time to time. When oil separates put remove from heat.
Serve hot boiled fried rice, chapatti.

recipes.name: Chicken Montajan
instructions: Cut the chicken into eight pieces. Heat oil in pan.
Fry the onion, add all ingredients except the raisins and almonds.
Cover and cook over moderate heat until water dries, add raisins.
Fry the meat stirring constantly till gravy becomes thick and oil comes on surface.
Dish out and garnish with sliced almonds.
Serve hot with bread and salad.

recipes.name: Balti Chicken
instructions: In a skillet heat the oil and fry brown the onions.
When the onion get golden brown then add tomatoes and simmer it.
Now mixed and fry the leaves of cinnamon, black cardamom, whole black pepper, cumin, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder and salt to taste.
Now add chicken and simmer it properly.
Then add yogurt mixed it and cover it by lid and fry it.
Then cover off the lid and fry it on high flame.
When the chicken get smooth and gravy raise thick then add lemon juice.
In the end garnish with green chilies and serve it.

recipes.name: Darbari Chicken
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and add ginger garlic paste along with chicken. Fry well.
Add in grinded onion, crushed red chili, turmeric, salt, cumin, and dry fenugreek leaves.
Cook for 15 minutes on low flame and then turn the flame high, fry well.
Now add in milk, cream, almond, and cook for 10 minutes more.
Take out in a serving dish, garnish with fresh coriander and green chilies.

recipes.name: Green Thai Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat, add shallots and ginger.
Stir-fry until fragrant.
Reduce heat to medium, stir in curry paste.
Stir in chicken broth, cook until broth is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.
Stir in chicken, coconut milk, bamboo shoots and salt, heat to a boil.
Reduce heat, simmer for five minutes.
Pour in bowls with lime wedges on the side for squeezing.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Hunan Chicken
ingredients: A pinch of white pepper powder
instructions: Cut the chicken breast in thin slices and pre blanch in boiling water then set aside.
Heat the wok and pour in the chilli oil.
Saute minced garlic, dry chilli and spring onion until the flavors come out.
Add the pre-boiled chicken and toss in the spring onion.
Add the chilli garlic and Maggi seasoning and simmer over low flame.
Pour chicken soup stock together with soy sauce into the mix and bring to a boil.
Add a pinch of white pepper as per your taste and increase the flame.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Methi Murg
instructions: Mix all the ingredients for the marinade and marinate the chicken for 30 minutes.
Grill in a preheated oven till golden brown.
For the curry: Heat oil in a pan and fry cardamom, cinnamon, black cumin seeds and onion till golden brown.
Add fenugreek and sauté for 3-4 minutes.
Add tomatoes and chicken and cook till the aroma of the fenugreek leaves emanates.
Drizzle lemon juice, garnish with ginger julienne and serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Achari
instructions: For Chillies: In a pan put ani seed, mustard seed, cumin and kalonji roast and grind.
In ground masala add lemon juice to make thick paste.
Cut green chillies in length wise and fill this masala.
For Chicken: Heat oil in pan fry sliced onion until brown then add ginger garlic paste and fry.
Add tomato, red chilli, turmeric and salt cook well.
Now add chicken cook until tender then add yogurt and green chillies and remaining masala.
Cook on slow flame for about 10 minutes then add julinne ginger and serve.

recipes.name: Dhaniya Chicken
instructions: In a pan heat oil put tomato paste and all ingredients except coriander leaves.
Cut chicken in karahi pieces add in pan and cook for 5 minutes.
Add 1 cup water cover with lid and cook for 15 minutes till chicken tender.
Sprinkle with coriander leaves and green chillies.
Serve hot with naan or chapattis.

recipes.name: Punjabi Chicken
ingredients: Chopped garlic. Same amount as onion
Green chillies according to your taste
instructions: Take 2 onions and 2 tomatoes and same amount of ginger garlic chopped in a blender and add all the spices.
Add some water.. this will turn out in a paste
Cook this paste in a pot untill done ... dont let it dry.
Take oil or ghee (for real Punjabi taste) in a pan and fry the remaining one chopped onion in it.
Add remaining chopped ginger garlic in it and fry. Then add chicken and fry it until it gets some brown colour.
Then add the remaining one chopped tomatoes and cook it until it softens and mixed in the onion masala.
Then add the cooked gravy and let it simmer until the chicken is done. add the lime juice and sprinkle coriander and mint leaves
When serving with lil bit of crushed black pepper.
You can melt some butter over it.

recipes.name: Pailwani salan
instructions: First grind black pepper, zeera, ginger and garlic and keep aside
Then take a pan add oil and fry chopped onion and fry until golden brown
Add Chicken and fry for 3 min
Add grounded Garam masala, chopped tomatoes, Red chilli powder, salt and fry for 5 mins
Add the fenugreek leaves and peas and fry until chicken is cooked
Leave it for dumm (cover the pot to hold steam) until oil is separated.
Ready to serve!

recipes.name: Pepper Chettinad Chicken Curry
instructions: Clean and cut the chicken into 8 pieces each.
Pound the peppercorns with a pestle.
Whisk the yogurt and add the peppercorns, half the ginger and garlic pastes, lemon juice and salt.
Mix well and marinade the chicken pieces in it for at least 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a handi.
Add onions and saute over medium heat until light brown.
Add the remaining ginger and garlic pastes and saute until onions are golden brown.
Add the tomatoes and stir-cook till the fat appears on the sides of the pan.
Add the chicken along with the marinade and stir for 4-5 minutes.
Add 240 ml/1 cup water and bring to boil.
Cover and let simmer, stirring occasionally until the chicken is tender.
Adjust the seasoning. Sprinkle garam masala and stir.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with boiled rice or roti

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Laal Chicken
ingredients: White cumin roasted and crushed 1 tsp
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, tomato puree, brown onion, ginger garlic paste, salt, chili powder, turmeric, white cumin, garam masala powder, orange color, whole mixed spices, and mint leaves for 2 hours.
Heat oil add big green chili slice, handful curry leaves, black cumin seeds, and add marinated chicken.
Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until chicken tender. Dish out and serve.

recipes.name: Baked Mutton Leg
instructions: Debone mutton leg and beat with hammer. Apply papaya paste and leave for 1 hour.
In a bowl combine lemon juice, ginger garlic paste, green chilies, red chili, black pepper, garam masala, salt and oil.
Coat mutton leg with this marination and leave for 4-6 hours.
Then put mutton leg on aluminium foil, top with onion, tomato, and capsicum and wrap carefully.
Bake in preheated oven at 180 C for 40-50 minutes or until fully tender.
Set in serving platter garnish with lemon wedges and sliced onion and serve

recipes.name: Siri Paye
ingredients: Garam masala Powder (with nutmeg and mace) 1tbsp
instructions: Separate the brain from the skull. In a pot pour 2 cups of water and add 1/2tsp of turmeric and boil it.
Then add brain to it and boil for 4 to 5 mins. Then strain it and put aside.
Now in a pot put the skull and feet and add 1tbsp of Ginger garlic paste, onion; stir fry 4-5 minutes then add sufficient amount of water and cook for 4-5 hours.
Take another pan, pour oil to heat, add bay leaves, cloves and green cardamoms; stir fry it.
Now add 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, yogurt, coriander powder, garam masala powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder and salt to taste and stir fry it.
When masala is ready add the skull and feet to it along gravy and cook on low flame. Set consistency of gravy according to desire. Sprinkle Garam masala powder add brain and at the end.
Now serve with fried onions, green chilies, ginger, fresh coriander, lemons.

recipes.name: Noor Jehani Qorma
instructions: Blanch almonds and keep a side.
Fry onion until brown and take out, crush and keep a side.
Add ginger garlic paste and other spices and fry.
Now add yogurt and meat fry well.
Now add fried and crushed onion and almond with little water, cook on lower flame to allow meat tender well.
When meat tenderized, fry for a while then remove.
Noor jehani qorma is ready to enjoy with naan.

recipes.name: Gosht Saag Wala
instructions: Clean, wash, boil and blend spinach with green chilies, tomatoes and fenugreek leaves, keep aside.
Heat oil add brown onion, ginger garlic paste with all the seasonings and mutton, fry for 10 minutes.
Add in yogurt, fry well.
Add 1 ½ cup water, cover and cook till mutton nearly done.
Add in your blended spinach mixture cover and cook again till oil comes on top.
Lastly add milk and dried fenugreek, fry and remove.

recipes.name: Mirchi Keema
instructions: Heat oil fry onion until soft remove half of the fried onion and keep aside.
Allow remaining onion to fry until golden.
Add ginger garlic paste, salt, chili powder, turmeric, coriander and cumin.
Add mince, fry well until oil comes out.
Remove half the mince and keep aside.
Cut capsicum and tomatoes in 1 inch pieces and keep aside.
Put the tomatoes on the mince on the pan.
Cover with remaining onion which we took out.
Add capsicum on top of onion, cover with remaining mince.
Add Garam masala powder over the mince, green chilies, coriander leaves and lemon juice.
Cover with lid and cook on low flame.
Simmer once and remove, serve with roti.

recipes.name: Special Korma
instructions: Beat yogurt, mix with coconut, almonds, poppy seed, saffron, ginger garlic paste, coriander powder, chili powder, Garam masala powder and turmeric.
Heat oil add cinnamon, green cardamom and mutton, fry well.
Add in yogurt mixture and fry well.
Add 2 cup water, cover and cook till meat tender.
Then add brown onion, coriander leaves, green chilies, mint leaves and saffron.
When oil comes on top, remove and serve.

recipes.name: Darbari Brain Masala
instructions: Wash and remove veins from brain.
Heat oil in a wok, fry chopped onion till light golden.
Add ginger garlic paste, salt, chili powder, tomatoes and yogurt, fry well till oil comes on top.
Add brain, cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Lastly add cream, garam masala powder, coriander, green chilies and ginger.
Serve with nan.

recipes.name: Bengali Mutton Curry
instructions: Cut potatoes into cubes and fry them till golden brown.
Add in mustard oil in the pan and add in onion.
Fry them till they are golden brown.
Add in mutton, salt, turmeric and ginger garlic paste and cook it.
When the water of the meat dries, add in red chilies, coriander seeds, cinnamon, black pepper and a bay leave.
Sauté it and when the meat tenders add in fried potatoes, green chilies and lemon juice.
Simmer it and serve Bengali Mutton curry with plain rice.

recipes.name: Gulabi Mutton
instructions: Heat 4 – 5 tbsp oil in a wok, add in onion and sauté till golden brown.
Then add ginger garlic paste and mutton.
Fry well till its color is changed and water dries.
Add cloves, green cardamoms, tomato paste and yogurt.
Mix well and cook for 1 – 2 minutes.
Then add Garam masala powder, chili powder, salt and water as required.
Cover and cook for 25 – 30 minutes till meat is tender.
Lastly add almond and coriander leaves.
Dish it out garnish with ginger and serve hot.

recipes.name: Raan Dum Pukht
instructions: Mark cuts on whole mutton leg, marinate with a little salt, lemon juice and papaya paste.
In another pan heat butter and oil.
Add in onion and sauté till softened.
Then add mutton leg, fry well till its color is changed.
Add ginger garlic paste, vinegar, cumin seeds, turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder and garam masala powder.
Fry well for 1 – 2 minutes, now add 1 glass of water, cover and cook for 25 – 30 minutes.
Now remove lid, add coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies and ginger. Mix well.
Now remove mixture in a serving platter.
Sprinkle with chaat masala and serve hot.

recipes.name: Mutton Steam
instructions: Marinate mutton with salt, vinegar and ginger garlic paste. Mix well.
In a bowl add chili powder, garam masala powder, cumin powder, nutmeg, yogurt and chaat masala. Mix well.
Then fry the marinated mince till golden brown.
Again coat the mutton pieces with yogurt mixture.
Then cook in steamer till tender.
Dish it out and serve hot.

recipes.name: Lagan Kay Kofty
instructions: Marinate mince with salt and papaya for 15 minutes.
Then add to ginger garlic paste, chili powder, brown onion, chopped coriander, chopped green chilies, garam masala powder and ground roasted gram.
Mix everything well, make into round balls, spread in a greased lagan.
Cook for 5 minutes, then add in oil, in another pan.
Sauté onion till light brown, add in it yogurt.
Fry for 5 minutes, remove, pour this over to kofta and serve immediately.

recipes.name: IlahaBadi Champ
instructions: Beat mutton chops with steak hammer.
In a wok heat 2 – 3 tbsp oil, add ginger garlic paste and mutton chops.
Fry fro 2 – 3 minutes.
Now add nutmeg mace powder, salt, black pepper powder, cinnamon powder, chili powder, turmeric, yogurt and cumin seeds. Mix well.
Now add 1 cup water, cover and cook for 20 – 25 minutes till chops are tender.
Now remove chops from pan, coat with ½ cup flour.
Dip in beaten egg. Sprinkle with 1 tbsp sesame seeds.
Now deep fry till golden brown.
Remove from oil.
Serve with lemon juice and onion

recipes.name: Bhopali Korma
ingredients: Nutmeg and mace powder ½ tsp
instructions: In a muslin cloth place the whole coriander and cumin then wrap it.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the finely sliced onion and ginger garlic paste for a few minutes.
Add in mutton and the spice bag.
Fry the mutton until the onions are uniformly distributed.
Add the yogurt, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric, all spice powder, cardamom powder, fennel seeds, salt, nutmeg and mace powder.
Add 1 cup water, cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the meat is tender.
Now add the green chilies and increase the flame.
Cook until the gravy thickens.
The bhopali korma is now ready to serve.

recipes.name: Balochi Bhindi Gosht
instructions: Remove top and bottom of ladyfingers.
Deep fry in oil till golden brown, remove and keep aside.
In blender put together onion, ginger, garlic clove and 1 cup water. Blend finely to a paste.
Heat oil in pan, add mix whole spice and ginger garlic paste. Fry for 4 – 5 minutes.
Now add turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder and mutton.
Also add 1 cup water, cover and cook for 20 – 25 minutes.
Add salt, yogurt and fried ladyfingers.
Mix well and simmer for 4 – 5 minutes till oil comes on top.
Lastly sprinkle garam masala powder and serve hot.

recipes.name: Mutton Turnip Curry
instructions: Add onion and tomatoes in blender with half cup water and blend well.
Peel turnips and boil them.
Heat clarified butter and add onion mixture, ginger, garlic, salt, red chili, turmeric and roast well.
When clarified butter becomes up then add meat and cook for a while.
Then add two cups water and cook more.
When meat tenderized then combine boiled turnips and one cup water and cook for 10 minutes.
Finally add garam masala powder, fresh coriander and green chilies and turn off stove.
Serve with boiled rice, salad or bread.

recipes.name: Mutton Aloo Bukhara
instructions: In a pan heat oil, add ginger garlic paste and mutton.
Fry well till its color turn to golden brown.
Now add red chili powder, salt, turmeric and water as required.
Cover and cook on low flame for 20 – 25 minutes.
Now remove lid, add dry plum, black pepper, garam masala powder and tomatoes.
Fry well on high flame till water dries.
Dish it out and serve hot.

recipes.name: Dahi Kashmiri Gosht
instructions: Take 3 cup water in a wok along with undercut, onion, ginger, garlic, cinnamon stick, coriander seeds and salt to make stock.
Boil it and after 5-10 minutes take out the meat and drain the stock.
Now take 1 cup oil in a wok and fry chopped onions till golden brown.
Take them out in a tissue paper make it dry and crisp.
Now add the meat in that oil.
Blend yogurt and onion together in a blender.
When the water in the meat dries add in the blended mixture and add red chilies, ginger garlic, white cumin seeds, coriander seeds, black pepper and green chilies.
Then add in some salt and stock.
Cook it on a low flame.
Add butter when the oil separates and cook it for 10 minutes on a low flame.
Serve Dahi Kashmiri Gosht with nan.

recipes.name: Jahangiri Korma
instructions: Take half of the yogurt and mix in dry coriander, black pepper, turmeric, salt, red chili powder, cumin, ginger and garlic.
Now add yogurt mixture to meat and set aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
Now heat oil in a pan, add onions and fry till golden.
Now add in meat and cook for a while.
When meat is cooked and water reduces.
Add the remaining yogurt, cover and cook for five minutes on low flame.
When oil starts to separate and rich aroma is erupting from the pan, turn off the flame.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and almonds.

recipes.name: Gosht Dopiyaza
instructions: In a pan put together oil, mutton pieces, tomatoes, salt, green chilies, onions, and yogurt.
Then add crushed red chili, ginger, garlic, white cumin seeds, whole red chilies, mixed whole spice and turmeric.
Cook over low flame for 30 minutes.
If required add water.
When meat is tender, stir fry till oil forms a layer.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

recipes.name: Mughlai Mutton Malai
instructions: Marinate meat with salt, yogurt, coriander powder, garam masala powder, lemon juice, cumin, chili powder, brown onion, ginger garlic paste and green cardamom powder, leave to marinate for 1 hour.
Heat oil add marinated mutton, cover and simmer on low flame for 30 minutes.
Add in cashew nuts paste mixed with malai, kewra water, saffron and mint leaves.
Leave it on simmer till oil floats on top.
Serve with naan.

recipes.name: Bori Curry
instructions: First heat pan and roast whole red chili, peanuts, chick pea powder, almond and sesame seeds.
Now grind the roasted spices almond with onion, garlic, coconut, coriander, cumin and red chili with stock.
Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves, cinnamon stick and cloves, fry for a minute.
Now add meat, turmeric, roasted and the ground paste and sautée for 3 – 4 minutes.
Cook till meat tender, then put potato, tamarind paste, coconut and salt.
When curry is prepared garnish it with coriander and mint and dish it out.

recipes.name: Mutton Dry Fruit Curry
instructions: First pour clarified butter into a pan.
Now add cinnamon stick, clove, ginger garlic chopped and mutton into the pan and cook it on high flame from 4 to 5 minutes.
Put brown onion into the pan.
Pour yogurt into the pan and cook for a couple of minutes.
Now add white pepper, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili, garam masala and water, cook till mutton tenders.
After that put tomato, green chili, salt and all dry fruit and cook it for 10 minute.
In the end put cream from top and dish it out.

recipes.name: Keri ka Dopiyaza
instructions: In a pan put together mutton, bunch of chopped coriander leaves and oil.
Add raw mangoes, whole green chilies, few curry leaves, chopped onion, turmeric, chili powder, ginger garlic paste and salt to taste.
Cook over low flame without adding water.
Cook well till water dries.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with plain boiled rice.

recipes.name: Akhrot Aab Gosht
instructions: Take a pan, pour some water as you required and put chops and stock into the pan.
Now add salt, cinnamon, clove, cardamom and brown onion and cook it well.
Boil milk with cardamom, clove and sugar.
When milk boiled, cool it down and add cream in it and pour it into the meat.
When meat cooked, put it on a side.
Now prepare a baghar.
Now take a pan and add oil, aniseed powder, cumin powder, white pepper and when smell starting to come, pour it on meat and dish it out.

recipes.name: Nehari
instructions: In a pan, roast cumin seeds, star anise, nutmeg, mace, fennel seeds and dry ginger powder.
Now grind the roasted spices well.
Now add in chili powder, turmeric powder, fennel seeds, garam masala powder and salt.
Mix well and divide the mixture in two parts.
Heat oil in pan, add ginger garlic paste and fry.
Mix spice mixture and coriander powder in 1 cup water and add to the oil.
Fry well. Add boiled beef and fry.
Now add stock and cook well till the mixture starts boiling.
Now roast wheat flour and dissolve in some water.
Put wheat mixture to the pan while moving spoon and cook for 10 minutes more.
Now turn the flame off.
In other pan heat ½ cup oil, add chopped onion and remaining roasted spice mixture.
Pour this on top of Nihari.
Serve with lemon cut into halves, chopped green chilies, coriander leaves and mint leaves.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Tala Hua Gosht
ingredients: Mint leaves and lemon wedges for garnish
instructions: Mix ginger garlic paste, red chili, turmeric, garam masala, meat tenderizer and salt. Marinade meat with the above spices and leave for 1 hour.
Heat oil in deep pan and fry meat on high flame.
Add ½ cup water in meat. Cover and cook on slow flame until meat tender and water dries.
Garnish with mint leaves and lemon wedges and serves with mint dip.

recipes.name: Maghaz Masala
instructions: Boil the veal brain with 2 cup of water, garlic cloves and black pepper.
Now clean the veal brain and cut into pieces.
In another pan fry the onions till they turn golden brown. Remove and place on an absorbent paper.
Now crush half of the onions by hand.
Heat oil in a pan and add red chili powder, turmeric powder whole spices, ginger garlic paste, yogurt and veal brain pieces.
Now don't stir but move the pan around by hand.
When the oil floats on top add lemon juice, chopped coriander, chopped green chilies and ginger.
Cook for 5 -7 minutes.
In the end serve in a dish with little bit of chopped coriander, ginger, green chili and whole spices.

recipes.name: Zafrani Paaye
instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Add onion and fry till its color turn to golden brown.
Now mix together yogurt, coriander powder, chili powder, nutmeg, mace, turmeric, saffron, ginger garlic paste and salt.
Add this to the pan and fry well.
Now add trotters and continue to fry.
Add stock, cover and cook over low flame for 30 minutes.
Turn the flame off.
Add all spice powder, green cardamom and black cumin seeds.
Serve with coriander leaves, green chilies, lemon, mint leaves and ginger juliennes.

recipes.name: Bong Do Piyaza
instructions: In a pan heat clarified butter with black cardamom, bay leaves, red chili, black pepper and cinnamon sticks to crackle.
Then add meat pieces to cook till it turn brown.
Then add ginger garlic paste to saute.
Now put yogurt and again cook for 2 to 3 minutes to saute.
Now pour as required water to cook till meat tender.
Then add onion, all spice powder, green chilies and salt to mix and cook till it turn thick.
Dish it out and serve.

recipes.name: Afghani Kabab
instructions: Take mince, crushed black pepper, eggs, salt, green chilies, coriander and onion in a bowl and mix well all the ingredients and make dough, leave for half hour.
Take a pan and put tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, crushed black pepper, salt and half cup oil in it and cook on low flame.
When the water of the tomatoes dries then sauté.
Heat oil in a frying pan and shallow fry the kabas.
Add tomato paste.
Afghani kabab are ready to serve with hot roghni nans.

recipes.name: Haleem
instructions: Soak wheat and all lentils for whole night.
Heat oil and add 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste fry for a while.
Add meat, 1 tsp turmeric, red chili and Garam masala powder mix well and cover and let it cook till meat is tenderize well.
When mutton tenderize add yogurt, lemon, 3 green chilies and 1 cup water simmer till oil comes on surface.
Let it cool at room temperature, now shred meat and keep a side.
Now in a large pan add wheat, mixed lentils, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, 3 green chilies, black pepper corn give a boil and cook to tenderize all lentils.
Blend all lentils and wheat in blender.
In a pan heat clarified butter and crackle all whole spices (clove, cinnamon stick, black pepper corn and cardamom.
Add blended lentils and meat mix and add some garnishing ingredients cook for 30 minutes to mix all ingredients well.
Haleem is ready, serve with garnishing ingredients.

recipes.name: Saag Qeema
instructions: Wash spinach, sua and fenugreek thoroughly and then soak them in water with ½ tsp of turmeric for 20 minutes.
Now heat oil in a skillet and sauté onions in it.
Add in 1 tbsp turmeric, red chili powder and ginger garlic paste and cook it for a while.
Add in the mince and salt and let it cook with other ingredients.
When the water dries out, add in all the soaked veggies and green chilies.
Mix them well.
Now, when the oil comes out, add in butter and cover to let it simmer.
Allow excess water to dry to out then garnish with fresh coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Shab Daig
instructions: Peel the turnips and potato and cut into four pieces.
Now wash and clean the mutton meat.
Then cut coriander leaves with green chillies fine.
Now add oil, meat, onion, turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder, ginger garlic paste and little water in pot.
Do the flame low and cook until meat is tender then turnoff stove.
Grind roasted chickpeas and cumin then mix in mince.
Add all spice powder grind the mince meat and then make small meatballs.
Now fry meatballs lightly and then fry turnips and potato in same oil.
Now add yogurt, sugar and tomatoes in meat pot and roast well.
Then add meatballs, potato, eggs and turnips in it and simmer on low heat with 3 to 4 glass water.
When the oil starts come up then add green spice, all spice powder, and lemon juice.
Simmer for 5 minutes more and serve with naan.

recipes.name: Gurday
instructions: Chop kidney in to small pieces.
Crush cloves of garlic and mix with kidneys.
Keep aside for 15 minutes and then wash with cold water.
In a wok, add kidneys and ginger garlic paste and allow cooking on low flame.
When kidneys are dry, add red chili flakes, crushed black pepper, white cumin powder and oil and stir together.
When oil forms a separate layer, add sliced coriander, sliced green chilies, salt and juice of lemons and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pickle Mince
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and put in curry leaves, white cumin and fenugreek.
When these spices begin to give off aroma, add sliced onion in the oil.
Fry until pale golden.
Add ginger and garlic paste and turmeric powder in the pan, stir for a minute and add mincemeat to the mixture.
After a wile also add the remaining spices, cloves of garlic, nigella seeds and green chilies.
Do not cover, stir occasionally until completely dry, serve hot.

recipes.name: Chillie Con carne
instructions: In a pan heat cooking oil put onions, garlic and brown it a little bit, then add qeema and brown it nicely too.
When the water get's dried, then add all the masalas and the tomatoes , also adding beans.
Cook it on a slow flame for 2 1/2 hours. The more you cook it, the tastier it will be.
Before serving the dish, take out the tezpata.

recipes.name: Mince & Brinjal Curry
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan,& saute the onions until they turn light pink, add the ginger & garlic paste, & stir fry the masala for about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the cumin & coriander seeds, add the cinnamon & cloves, and stir in 2 sliced green chillies.
Add the tomatoes & stir fry the masala till the oil comes to the surface.
Add the mince, & fry till it is well browned.
Add the water, cover, & simmer until the mince is tender.
Mash the brinjal with a fork,& add to the mince, along with the garam masala powder, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with green & red chillies.

recipes.name: Daal with Qeema
ingredients: Split black gram 1 cup (soaked for 1 hour)
Roasted and crushed white cumin 1 tsp
instructions: Heat oil in pan, add ginger garlic paste with mince, fry for 5 minutes.
Now add brown onion with chilli powder, salt, turmeric, cumin and coriander seeds, fry well.
Then add yogurt, continuously fry till oil comes on top.
Add soaked lentils, fry well.
Add 1 cup water, cover and cook till lentil tender.
Lastly add green chillies, coriander leaves and all spice powder, simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

recipes.name: Qeema Handi
instructions: Heat up oil and add ginger garlic paste in Handi and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, sliced ginger, chopped green chilies, red chili powder, turmeric powder, crushed black pepper, coriander powder and cumin powder. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Now add minced meat in it and cook for another few minutes.
Cover Handi with lid and leave for 10-15 minutes on a slow flame.
At the end, add butter and coriander.
Cover it for 2 minutes and your Qeema Masala Handi is ready.
Serve with Roghni Naan or Roti.

recipes.name: Keema Aaloo
instructions: Heat up oil in a pan and fry onions with whole mixed spices and onion till they turns golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste, tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder and salt. Cook for 5-6 minutes.
Add mince meat, mix well and cover with lid for 10 minutes.
Pour 1 cup water and add chopped dill and potatoes.
Cover with lid and let it cook till potatoes are tender.
Sprinkle coriander leaves, green chilies and all spice powder over it.
Serve with naan or roti.

recipes.name: Methi Kheema Salan
instructions: In a pan fry sliced onions in oil till golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt & methi leaves.
Fry at low heat for 4-5 minutes.
Add kheema & stir to allow the water to evaporate. Then add curds.
Fry a little adding a cup of water.
When half cooked, add whole onions.
Cook till oil floats on top and all the water dries up.
Serve hot with chapathis.

recipes.name: Shimla Mirch with Qeema Daal
instructions: Heat oil, fry onions, add minced meat, tomato, all seasoning and cook.
Lastly add green onion, green chilli, coriander, lemon juice and keep aside.
Now cut the top of capsicum, mix dal in mince & stuff in capsicum.
Sprinkle some chopped onions, tomatoes, cheese, now spread little oil on baking dish & place stuffed capsicum.
Bake for 10-15 minutes at 180 degree C and serve.

recipes.name: Qeema Karelay
instructions: Peel bitter gourds, cut lengthwise ito two pieces and deseed.
marinate them with salt and 1 tablespoon of turmeric and keep aside for an hour.
In a pot, slightly heat 2 tablespoons of Cooking Oil on medium heat for 2-3 minutes.
Golden fry the onions and then saute ginger garlic paste for a minute.
Add mincemeat, red chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder and cumin.
Mix well and cook on low heat until water in the mincemeat dries.
Stir well for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat.
Wash bitter gourds thourghly and pat dry with a cloth.
Fill mincemeat in one half, cover with the other and secure with a thread.
In a frying pan, heat Dalda Cooking Oil on medium heat for 3-4 minutes and fry the bitter gourds till golden.
Spread the remaining mincemeat in the pot and arrange bitter gourds on top.
Add tamarind and mix well.
Cover and simmer on low heat for 5-7 minutes.
Dish out and serve hot with chappati.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Keema
instructions: Cut cauliflower into florets and deep fry till light brown.
Heat 2 tbsps ghee, add all the dry ingredients and cook well.
Then add the keema and fry till brown.
Add curd and keep stirring till properly browned and cooked.
Keep adding the asafoetida mixed with 1/2 cup water one spoon at a time.
When keema is nearly cooked, add the cauliflower and stir slowly so that keema and cauliflower are mixed well.
Before serving, add crushed and roasted cashewnuts.

recipes.name: Masala Eggs and Mince
instructions: Boil the eggs.
Heat clarified butter in a frying pan and fry the eggs.
Heat clarified butter in a pot and fry finely sliced onions till they turn golden.
Dice the tomatoes and add them to the onions.
Add ginger/garlic paste and fry.
Add Garam masala powder, red chillies and turmeric powder.
Fry some more. Add mince and water and mix well.
Cover the pot with lid and keep the mince on low flame to cook.
When mince gets tender and oil appears on the surface, add green chillies and chopped coriander leaves.
Let it cook for a while and then add onion seeds and eggs.
Cover and steam on very low heat for a few minutes and then take out in a dish and serve.

recipes.name: Keema Shahzada
ingredients: Clarified butter or butter 4 tbsp heaped
instructions: Melt 2 tablespoon clarified butter or butter on medium flame and fry onion, ginger and garlic.
Strain out the fried ingredients and reserve in a plate.
Now add remaining clarified butter or butter in pan and mix in ground spice 1 and 2.
Then add mincemeat, turmeric and water.
Cook until water dries (approximately 10 minutes).
Now add milk in food processor and add fried onion, ginger and garlic. Blend well.
Mix this ground mixture in mince meat along with cashew.
Cover and cook again for 10 to 15 minutes.
Then take out meat in serving dish and garnish with boiled eggs and fresh coriander leaves.

recipes.name: Smoke Khasta Keema
ingredients: Onion rings and mint leaves for garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a wok and add onion paste, fry for 5 minutes till light golden.
Add ginger garlic paste, fry for 2 minutes, remove and keep aside.
Marinate mince with yogurt, salt, all spice, chili powder, cardamom powder, ground nutmeg, ground mace, ground poppy seeds, coconut and cashew nuts.
Mix marinated mince with fried onion and ginger garlic mixture.
Put a burning coal over the mince, pour few drops of oil on coal, cover the pan immediately and leave for 5 minutes.
Remove the coal from mince.
Cover and cook mince over low flame till tender and oil separates,
In the end ass screw pine.
Garnished with onion rings and mint leaves.
Serve hot with rawa maeda paratha.

recipes.name: Bhartay Wala Qeema
instructions: Wash and boil eggplants.
When they are properly boiled mash it with the help of a fork.
Take oil in the pan and add onion in it.
Fry them till they are golden brown.
Add mince in it and add ginger garlic paste, red chili, salt and turmeric in it.
Cook it till the water of the mince dries.
Chop and add tomatoes in it.
When the water of the tomatoes dries add in dries eggplants, tamarind paste, jiggery, curry leaves, green chilies and nigella seeds.
Simmer it for 5 minutes.
Bhartay wala qeema is ready to serve

recipes.name: Paneer Qeema
instructions: On a large griddle put together mince, salt, ginger garlic paste and turmeric.
Cook till water dries.
Add in red pepper, green chilies and cooking oil. Fry well.
Cut cottage cheese into cubes, shallow fry separately till golden brown.
Now spread the fried cheese on top of mince.
Also add black pepper, juice of lemons, few coriander and mint leaves. Fry well.
Now dish it out.
Garnish with ginger, mint leaves, coriander leaves, sliced green chilies and fried brown onion.

recipes.name: Keema Hari Piyaz
instructions: Heat oil add onion, fry till light golden.
Add ginger garlic paste with mince, fry well.
Add salt, coriander powder, dry fenugreek, cumin seed, black pepper, chili powder, crushed red pepper and turmeric with chopped tomatoes, brown onion, fry well till oil comes on top.
Add in spring onions, green chilies, sliced ginger, garam masala and coriander leaves.
Mix well and serve hot with naan or chapati.

recipes.name: Keema Cholay
ingredients: Roasted and ground white cumin 1 tbsp
instructions: Boil a cup of soaked chickpeas with red lentils.
When chickpeas are tender, add a pinch of soda.
In a cooking pot, add mince meat, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, salt, tomatoes and and let it cook.
When mince meat begins to dry, add oil and squeezed lemons and sauté thoroughly.
Now add chickpeas and let it cook on low flame.
When it comes to a boil, add tamarind juices, roasted and ground cumin and crushed black pepper.
After cooking it for 5 minutes, add a bunch of mint, ginger, green chilies, coriander and put on dam for 2 minutes.
Serve delicious keema Cholay with naan.

recipes.name: Tikka Balls
instructions: Blend all ingredients for balls and remove in a bowl.
Make small balls of the mixture.
Heat oil in a pot saute ginger garlic paste till aroma comes.
Add remaining ingredients and cook for 10 minutes.
When tomatoes become tender blend all spices in a blender.
Put mixture back in the pot.
Add yogurt and cook balls on low flame for 10 minutes.
Dish out when the oil separates.
Then garnish with fresh coriander and green chilies.

recipes.name: Pickle Mince
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and put in curry leaves, white cumin and fenugreek.
When these spices begin to give off aroma, add sliced onion in the oil.
Fry until pale golden.
Add ginger and garlic paste and turmeric powder in the pan, stir for a minute and add mincemeat to the mixture.
After a wile also add the remaining spices, cloves of garlic, nigella seeds and green chilies.
Do not cover, stir occasionally until completely dry, serve hot.

recipes.name: Chillie Con carne
instructions: In a pan heat cooking oil put onions, garlic and brown it a little bit, then add qeema and brown it nicely too.
When the water get's dried, then add all the masalas and the tomatoes, also adding beans.
Cook it on a slow flame for 2 1/2 hours. The more you cook it, the tastier it will be.
Before serving the dish, take out the tezpata.

recipes.name: Mince & Brinjal Curry
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan,& saute the onions until they turn light pink, add the ginger & garlic paste, & stir fry the masala for about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the cumin & coriander seeds, add the cinnamon & cloves, and stir in 2 sliced green chillies.
Add the tomatoes & stir fry the masala till the oil comes to the surface.
Add the mince, & fry till it is well browned.
Add the water, cover, & simmer until the mince is tender.
Mash the brinjal with a fork,& add to the mince, along with the garam masala powder, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with green & red chillies.

recipes.name: Daal with Qeema
ingredients: Split black gram 1 cup (soaked for 1 hour)
Roasted and crushed white cumin 1 tsp
instructions: Heat oil in pan, add ginger garlic paste with mince, fry for 5 minutes.
Now add brown onion with chilli powder, salt, turmeric, cumin and coriander seeds, fry well.
Then add yogurt, continuously fry till oil comes on top.
Add soaked lentils, fry well.
Add 1 cup water, cover and cook till lentil tender.
Lastly add green chillies, coriander leaves and all spice powder, simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

recipes.name: Qeema Handi
instructions: Heat up oil and add ginger garlic paste in Handi and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, sliced ginger, chopped green chilies, red chili powder, turmeric powder, crushed black pepper, coriander powder and cumin powder. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Now add minced meat in it and cook for another few minutes.
Cover Handi with lid and leave for 10-15 minutes on a slow flame.
At the end, add butter and coriander.
Cover it for 2 minutes and your Qeema Masala Handi is ready.
Serve with Roghni Naan or Roti.
