instructions: Boil chicken with pinch of salt and remove from bones.
In a non sticking pan take 2 tbsp of oil and fry cabbage and carrot until cooked. Don't overcook. Now put boiled peas and spring onion. Stir for few minutes and set aside.
Now heat 1/2 cup oil in (preferably) non sticking pan. Add 2 beaten eggs and mix vigorously.
Put chicken in it and stir for some time then put cooked vegetables.
Add green chillies and from salt to soya sauce. Mix well.
Now put boiled rice stir and shake well by covering and holding the pan from sides so that all things mix well.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Khichdi
ingredients: A few sprigs of fresh green coriander, mint leaves chopped
instructions: Wash and soak lentils for 20 minutes.
Boil in just enough water with turmeric, till tender.
Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes. Bring water to boil.
Parboil rice with a little salt.
Drain the rice and set aside. Heat the oil.
Fry onions till golden brown.
Remove half and set aside. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry till golden.
Add turmeric and stir; add lentils and red chilli powder.
Cook for three minutes. Take a heavy-bottomed pan and brush a little oil in it. Spread half the parboiled rice; spread the lentils over the rice.
Sprinkle the ground spices.
Spread half of the coriander, mint and green chillies. Cover with remaining rice.
Sprinkle the fried onions, the rest of the coriander, mint leaves and green chillies and dot the rice with ghee.
Cook for about 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Nav Ratan Pulao
ingredients: 300 g basmati rice, washed and drained
instructions: Heat the oil in a heavy pan and add the cumin seeds.
When they start to pop, add the whole spices.
Stir a few times, then add the green chillies, all the vegetables, and the salt. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add the rice and fry until translucent.
Add 600 ml of hot water and bring to the boil, then lower heat, cover and cook until all the vegetables are soft but still crisp.
Serve hot, garnished with raisins.

recipes.name: Shahjahani Khichdi
instructions: Heat oil, add onion and fry till pink.
Add mince along with ginger garlic paste, salt, chilli powder, cumin crushed, garam masala powder and cardamom powder, fry well.
Now add yogurt fry well, cover and cook for 10 minutes till mince tender.
Add chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves and green chillies.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add brown onion, ginger garlic paste, soaked rice and lentils mixture, fry till light brown.
Now add turmeric, whole spices, salt and 2 cups of water, cover and cook till done.
To Serve: Spread cooked khichri over mince, add milk, fried onion on top.
Simmer for 15 minutes, before serving mix gently and remove from heat.

recipes.name: Landi Kotal Biryani
instructions: Heat oil fry sliced onion till golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste, crushed red chillies, salt, coriander seed and crushed cumin seed.
Put 1/2 cup water fry well add chicken fry more.
Add 1/2 cup more water and cover lid cook till chicken tender.
When chicken done add green coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chillies, spring onions and tomatoes remove from stove.
For Layer: In pan put half layer of boiled rice, and a layer of cooked chicken then layer of chick peas and rest of boiled rice.
Cover well and give steam for 15 minutes.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Pulao Nawabi
instructions: Soak basmati rice for half an hour.
Heat ghee in a saucepan, and saute onion on medium heat till golden brown.
Drain and keep aside. In the same pan add cumin seeds.
When it begins to crackle, add cashew nuts and raisins and stir for half a minute.
Then add soaked rice and salt and enough water to cover the rice.
Bring it to a boil and reduce the heat to low.
Cover and let it cook on low heat till almost done.
Garnish with coriander and fried onion and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Coconut Shrimp Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat; add mustard seeds, and sauté until seeds begin to pop.
Add onion and next 4 ingredients, and sauté 3 minutes.
Add shrimp; sauté 2 to 3 minutes or just until they begin to turn pink.
Remove shrimp; cover and keep warm.
Add rice to the pan, and sauté 1 minute.
Stir in water and coconut milk; bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Serve shrimp over rice.
Sprinkle with cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Fragrant Red Lentils with Rice
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add diced onion, and sauté 6 minutes or until onion begins to brown. Add the ginger and next 5 ingredients (ginger though bay leaves), and sauté for 1 minute. Add 3 cups water, lentils, and salt, and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Discard bay leaves.
Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add green onions and jalapeño; sauté 5 minutes. Add to the lentil mixture; stir in juice, cilantro, and garam masala.
Place 1/2 cup rice into each of 5 shallow bowls; spoon 3/4 cup lentil mixture over rice. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon yogurt.
Note: Because jalapeño peppers can vary in heat intensity, you may wish to adjust the amount used based on your own preference for hot and spicy foods.

recipes.name: Burnt Chilli Rice
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic sliced round fried golden brown and drained on tissue paper
2 spring onions (just the leaves) finely chopped
1 tbsp finely chopped coriander to garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a pan add the chillies and fry for 1 minute or till they crackle then add the garlic and green onion.
Saute it for a minute and add the rice toss to mix well and heat the rice through.
Season with salt, pepper and soya sauce and paprika.
Now serve on a platter and garnish with fried garlic and coriander.
You can sprinkle some fish floss if you on top too before serving.

recipes.name: Spanish Rice
ingredients: 2 tbsp each tomato sauce and tomato puree
instructions: Boil the corn and keep aside.
Wash and soak the rice in water for 10-15 minutes.
Heat the oil in a saucepan, fry the onions till they turn light brown in colour and add the garlic. Fry briefly.
Add the vegetables and the boiled corn to the onion garlic mixture.
Add the tomato puree.
Cook till the puree dries, and add the tomato sauce.
Add the rice, and season well with the salt and pepper. Mix gently.
Add the vegetable stock.
Simmer over low heat.
When the rice is cooked, season it with the Worcestershire sauce.

recipes.name: Cholay Biryani
ingredients: 1 inch piece ginger (cut into thin strips)
instructions: Soak kabuli chana overnight in four cups of water.
Drain & pressure cook in 4 cups of water with salt & tea leaves tied in piece of muslin cloth, till tender.
Remove the muslin cloth bag and drain chickpeas.
Soak rice in three cups of water for about half an hour. Drain.
Boil four cups of water in a deep pan with salt & green cardamoms, bay leaves & cloves.
Add rice and cook till half done. Drain excess water.
Marinate boiled chickpeas in yogurt, ginger paste, ginger julienne, half of mint leaves, green chilli paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala & garlic paste.
Dissolve saffron in warm milk and mix in kewra water.
Place the marinated chickpeas in a deep non-stick pan.
Spread cooked rice over the chickpeas evenly.
Sprinkle dissolved saffron and half of the coriander leaves over rice.
Cover the pan tightly and put on low heat for fifteen minutes or till rice is cooked.
Serve hot garnished with remaining coriander leaves and mint leaves.

recipes.name: Afghani Chicken Biryani
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes.
Parboil then in 10-12 cups of boiling water for 3-4 minutes and drain the water.
Clean and wash the chicken and make deep cuts.
In a wok or deep pot, heat cooking oil on medium heat for 4-5 minutes and golden fry the chicken on high heat.
Blend onions and tomatoes with 3 cups of water and pour it on the chicken.
Season with salt and black pepper, cover and cook on low heat until only half of the curry remains.
In a large pot, spread half of the boiled rice and place the whole chicken on them.
Cover the chicken with the remaining rice.
Pour the tomato gravy from the aside, cover and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes.
Remove the chicken and mix the rice well before dishing out.
Dish out the rice in a large round platter and place chicken in the middle. Garnish with pomegranate seeds on the side.

recipes.name: Seafood Fried Rice
ingredients: 5 gms salt and white pepper powder
instructions: Blanch all the vegetables and seafood. Keep aside.
Heat oil in wok and add egg yolk in a stream, stirring continuously.
When cooked, add all the vegetables and seafood.
Cook until the seafood is done.
Add rice, season with salt, pepper and soy sauce.
Toss well. Garnish with coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Coconut Curry Jasmine Rice
instructions: Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add onion, and sauté until tender.
Add curry powder and rice; cook 2 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients.
Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove bay leaf.
Note: Equal parts regular coconut milk and water may be substituted for light coconut milk.

recipes.name: Pulao in Hara Masala
ingredients: 1/2 blend in paste or crush well nutmeg
instructions: Heat the oil and add onions and the whole garam masala. Fry onions till the colour changes to light brown then add the hara masala and fry well till the colour and the aroma changes.
Now add the mutton pieces and cook well for 5 mins then add 1/2 cup water and cover.
When the water evaporates add the dry masalas with the salt and tomatoes and cook for another 5 mins.

Now add the water and the garam masala powder. When the water starts to boil then add the rice and cover the lid. When the half of the water is dried then leave the rice on very low flame for 10 mins.
Pulao is ready u can ser it with raita.
Note: Cooking mutton pulao then first make the mutton stock and use the stock instead of plain water and follow the same steps.

recipes.name: Kofta Pulao
instructions: To make the kofta:
In a grinder, dry grind roasted chana till it becomes fine powder.
To the raw keema add salt, a little chilli powder, shahzeera and roasted channa powder.
Grind this mixture into a fine paste and make lemon-sized balls and keep aside.
To make the curry:
In a vessel, take oil & add half garam masala, sliced onions and fry till golden brown.
Lower heat & add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt & ground paste.
Fry for 1 or 2 minutes while sprinkling some water.
Put curd and fry it for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water and when water boils put the kofta one by one.
Cook till the kofta are done and water dries up.
In another vessel, take enough water to boil & add remaining garam masala, & 2 tbsp salt.
Add rice. When the rice is three fourth cooked, drain out in a strainer.
In a thick bottom vessel spread half of ghee at bottom and pour half of the rice over it.
Spread out the kofta and the masala above it.
Sprinkle lime juice, coriander and mint leaves and green chillis.
Cover this again with a fresh layer of rice.
Put rest of the ghee on top with fried cashew nuts for garnishing.
Cover the vessel with a foil and a lid.
Put it on a medium flame for 12 to 15 minutes.
Mix slowly ensuring that the koftas do not break.
Serve hot with dahi ki chutney.

recipes.name: Cashew Nut Rice
instructions: Wash the rice 2 or 3 times with water and soak for 30 minutes.
In the meanwhile soak the cashew nuts in 1 cup water for just 15 minutes.
Bring water to a boil when boiling add the rice, turmeric powder and 1/4 tsp salt.
Rice should take about 11 minutes to cook.
Add a bit of oil leave for a minute and then throw the water and leave to dry.
Spread out on a tray and leave for 30 minutes.
In a wok heat oil dry the chili for one minute add the mustard seeds drained cashew nuts and curry leaves and fry for 30 seconds.
Add lemon juice and add the rice and mix it all together but carefully not to break the rice.
Sprinkle some freshly grated coconut if you like and serve.
Cashew nut rice is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Garlic Fried Rice
instructions: In a wok add the oil and garlic.
Now allow the oil to heat up on a moderate flame.
Once the garlic begins to sizzle add the onion a dash of salt and the rice.
Toss well to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Garlic fried rice is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Minted Rice with Sprouted Beans
instructions: Heat the oil in a large, nonstick wok or frying pan.
When it is hot, add the spring onions and garlic and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add the cooked rice and continue to stir-fry over a high heat for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the tomatoes and mixed sprouted beans and continue to cook over a high heat for 2-3 minutes or until warmed through.
Remove from heat, season and stir in the chopped mint leaves.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Mushroom Corn Rice
ingredients: 1/2 cup tinned or fresh mushrooms, chopped
instructions: Cook the rice in the water. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a saucepan and fry the onions.
Then add the green chilli-garlic paste to it.
Add the mushrooms and sauté for a minute.
Add the corn, salt and pepper. Mix well and keep aside.
Melt the butter, add the flour and fry briefly.
Add the milk and stir so that no lumps are formed.
Continue cooking till a thick white sauce is formed.
Add the sauce to the mushrooms and mix well.
Arrange the rice on a serving plate.
Pour the mushroom sauce over it and top it with the almonds.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Rice Supreme
ingredients: 1/2 cup each boiled peas and corn
1/2 cup each chopped capsicum and carrot
1 cup each chopped sprouts and tomatoes
instructions: Heat the oil in a saucepan and fry the onions, garlic, capsicum and sprouts.
Add the carrots, peas and corn to the onion mixture. Sauté for 5 minutes.
Add the vegetable stock and seasoning cubes and mix well.
Then add the tomatoes. Wash the rice and add to the above mixture.
Add the parsley, salt and pepper. Mix well.
Simmer over medium heat till the rice is cooked.
Remove from the heat, add the Worcestershire sauce and mix lightly.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Gulabi Pulao
instructions: Cook rice. Boil beetroot till tender, then scrape.
Heat 1 tbsp ghee, fry mustard seeds, pepper, cumin seeds, gram dhal, urad dhal and chopped green chilies.
When these turns brown and finely chop onions, and add them with curry leaves.
Cook until soft. Now add boiled beetroot to these vegetables.
After a few minutes add salt, turmeric powder and grated coconut.
Fry for a few seconds. Mix this whole mixture well with the cooked rice.
Fry cashew nuts in remaining ghee and add, season with lemon juice.
Cover the pulao and keep on a low heat for a few minutes.
Serve hot, with plain yogurt.

recipes.name: Mango Rice
instructions: Clean the rice and put it in boiling water.
When it is about three quarters cooked, remove it from the heat.
Drain the excess water and allow the rice to cool.
Add the turmeric powder and half the quantity ghee. Mix well.
Cut the mangoes into tiny pieces or grate them.
Grind the cumin seeds, half the chilies, salt to taste and the coconut gratings.
Mix it with the mango pieces and add it to the cooked rice.
Fry the mustard seeds gram dhal, curry leaves and the remaining chilies in oil.
Add to the rice. Mix well.
Allow to cool and serve.

recipes.name: Fish Biryani
instructions: Cut and wash the fish and boil in a cup of water with salt.
Remove and bone it. Keep aside. Wash rice.
Peel tomatoes and squeeze out pulp and juice.
Hard boil eggs and shell. Boil potatoes, peep and cut into cubes.
Grind turmeric, cumin seed, chilies, and garlic and 1/2 onion to a paste.
Extract 3 cups of coconut milk.
Heat ghee in a saucepan, slice and fry remaining 1/2 onion, put in the rice and stir well.
When slightly brown, pour in the coconut milk.
Add water if necessary so that the liquid will be 2 fingers above rice level.
When the rice is almost cooked, add the ground paste, fish and salt.
Mix gently and reduce heat.
Cover saucepan and place live charcoal gently on the lid, or bake in a moderate oven, till the rice is sufficiently dry.
Serve garnished with slices of hard boiled eggs and potatoes.

recipes.name: Sultana Biryani
instructions: Heat oil, add chicken, ginger, garlic, fry well add whole garam masala, add curd, tomato, red chili, haldi, salt, jaipal jawatri, garam masala, cumin brown onion, almond paste.
Bhuno well, add stock and cook.
Now mix masala and boiled rice.
Spread green chili, coriander and keep on dam. Garnish with sultana and serve.

recipes.name: Paneer Kofta and Kebab Biryani
instructions: Portion the kheema 1/2 for kababs and 1/2 for kabab curry.
Boil kheema in ginger-garlic paste.
Add green chillies and salt to it. Cook until it gets dry.
Prepare balls and deep fry them.
For the Curry:
Take remaining kheema. Add green chillies paste, red chilli powder and keep it aside for 10-15 mins.
Prepare balls. In a pan, put little oil, add jeera. Then add onions and fry them until pink.
Then add tomatoes, red chilli powder and turmeric and cook until it leaves the edges of the pan.
Then add water and cook masala.
Then add prepared balls and cook until the gravy becomes thick.
Note: Drain water before preparing kababs. For Rice:
Grind onion, ginger and garlic to a paste. Heat ghee and add ground paste to it.
Fry until it turns light brown. Add the spices. Fry for a minute and then the rice water and salt.
Cover and cook till the rice is tender for the koftas. Roast gramflour to a golden brown.
Knead paneer, gramflour, ginger and green chillies to a smooth dough.
Make 20 equal sized koftas. Deep fry till light brown.
Final Stage:
Fluff the rice with a fork and remove whole spices.
Add koftas and toss gently.
Put gravy in the centre of the plate and garnish with koftas and fried kababs.

recipes.name: Junglee Pulao
ingredients: 1 tsp Red Chilli Powder (Pisi Lal Mirch) (or to taste)
A few strands of Fresh Coriander/Cilantro Leaves (Hara Dhania) (chopped)
4 tbsp Clarified Butter (Ghee) or Cooking Oil
instructions: Wash meat well. In a large pot, combine: meat, 4 cups water, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and turn heat to medium and let meat cook covered until it is well done and water has completely dried. (If the meat has cooked but the water has not evaporated then turn heat to high and continue to fry meat until the water has completely dried.) Turn off heat and set aside.

Separately in a deep frying pan, heat a little clarified butter or cooking oil until well hot. Add all whole masalas and fry until they splutter. Add onions and fry until they turn brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and tomatoes and mix. Add all of the rest powdered masala and fry masala well by adding a bit of water to avoid sticking/burning as needed.

Add cilantro/coriander leaves and continue to fry well until the clarified butter or oil starts to separate from the masala (a sign that the masala is well fried.) Add rice and fry for a minute or two or until the colour changes a bit. Add the cooked meat and 3 cups of water and mix. When water comes to a boil, lower heat and let rice simmer until they are well done and water has completely dried.

recipes.name: Kathal Jackfruit Rice Biryani
instructions: Soak the rice in 3 cups of water for half an hour. Drain.
Boil the rice in 6 cups of water, adding a little salt, 2 green cardamoms, 2 black cardamoms, the cloves and 1 stick of cinnamon, till half done.
Drain and refresh in cold water and drain again.
Grease a knife with oil & cut the jackfruit into slices.
Peel & cut into 1 and a half inch cubes.
Heat the oil in a kadai & deep fry the jackfruit cubes.
Drain & set aside.
In the same oil, deep fry half the onions till golden crisp. Drain.
In a separate pan, heat 3 tbsp of ghee.
Add the shahi jeera and remaining green cardamoms, black cardamom & crushed cinnaomon.
Add the remaining onions and saute for a few seconds.
Add the ginger paste and garlic paste and continue to saute.
Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander, chilli powder & continue to saute for 2 minutes.
Stir in the fried jackfruit cubes.
Add the yogurt, salt & coriander leaves.
Soak the saffron in lukewarm milk.
Preheat the oven to 200 degree C.
Arrange half the jackfruit mixture in a large oven proof dish.
Spread a layer of rice over the jackfruit.
Sprinkle saffron milk, garam masala powder, a few mint leaves & few drops of kewra over rice.
Layer the rest of jackfruit & rice.
Garnish with fried onions, a few mint laeaves and remaining kewra water.
Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil & cook in oven for 20-25 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

recipes.name: Moti Kofta Rice Pulao
instructions: To make the koftas, add all the kofta ingredients (except egg) in minecemeat and grind twice on a sill or in food processor.
Add egg and mix well and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.
Apply some Cooking Oil on hands and make small minecemeat balls.
Refrigerate for the koftas for 10-15 minutes.
To make the gravy, heat Dalda Cooking Oil in a pot on medium heat for 3-5 minutes and add whole garam masala.
When it pops, add onions and stir fry till golden.
Add all the gravy spices, yogurt and tomatoes and stir well until oil separates.
Add a cup of water and bring to a boil.
Add the koftas to the gravy and lightly shake the pot with potholders.
Cook until the water dries completely.
Sprinkle green chillies and fresh coriander and add 4-5 cups of water.
When it comes to a boil, add rice.
Cover and cook on medium heat till the water dries.
Simmer on low heat for 5-7 minutes.
Dish out care fully to prevent koftas from breaking.
Garnish with boiled eggs if you wish and serve hot.

recipes.name: Lamb Pulao
instructions: Heat 5 cups water.
Add the lamb, ginger powder, aniseed powder, asafoetida, and salt.
Cook covered on high heat until the lamb is almost done.
Separate the lamb from the stock. Put both aside.
Heat the ghee in a deep pot, add all the ingredients from cloves to almonds, and the lamb.
Saute for a minute, add rice and saute further for 1 minute.
Add 6 cups of stock (adding water if needed) and stir gently.
Mix saffron with a little hot water and grind.
Add to the pot, cook covered on high heat until the water is almost absorbed.
Place the pot on a griddle (tawa), cook covered on low heat, till the rice is done.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve.

recipes.name: Shahi Kabuli Pulao
instructions: Heat up oil in a pan and fry onions till golden brown.
Separate the fried onions and grind them.
Fry chicken pieces in the same oil till light golden and than add grinded onions.
Add 3 cups of water and cook for 10 minutes.
Add cloves, black cardamom, cinnamon sticks, green cardamom and white cumin seeds.
Cook till chicken tenders.
Separate chicken and add chicken stock cubes in the remaining mixture.
Add rice and mix well. Also place chicken pieces at the top.
Cover with lid and let the rice cook. Garnish with dried fruits when ready to serve.
For topping: Heat up 2 tbsp of oil in a pan and fry carrot, almond, pistachios, raisins, green cardamom powder and sugar. Cook for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle this mixture over rice and serve.

recipes.name: Kabab Biryani
instructions: For the kebab: Wash the minced beef and put in a strainer and gently press to squeeze out all the water.
Mix all the kebab ingredients to the minced and knead well, set aside for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, divide minced mixture into lemon-sized balls, flatten with palm give shape like kebab and deep fry.
For the korma: Fry onions till golden brown.
Then make a paste of fried onion, yogurt and tomatoes.
Fry ginger, garlic then add the onion, yogurt, tomato paste in it.
Now add coriander powder, red chilli powder and salt; cook it for 2-3 minutes.
Then add green cardamom and plums, cook it till become korma.
For the rice: Bring to boil rice with white cumin, whole black peppercorn, cloves, large cardamoms, cinnamon stick and salt.
Then put in a strainer to squeeze out all the water.
To Assemble Biryani: Take medium size deep pot, put a layer of half rice at the bottom of the pot.
Now put a layer of korma then place half kebabs over it.
Put mint leaves, tomatoes, green chillies and ginger.
Then put a layer of remaining rice then put kebabs over it.
Add food colour and simmer for 10 minutes.
Delicious kebab biryani is ready.
Garnish with lemon slices, mint leaves and tomato; serve hot.

recipes.name: Kachay Gosht Ki Biryani
instructions: Rice preparation: Leave rice for half hour in water, then drain them.
Take water in a cooking pot.
Now add salt & black cumin in the above pot.
Also cardamom (bari ilaichi), green cardamom & black pepper.
Now add mint leaves a little bit, green chilies, clove & cinnamon.
Now add rice in the above pot, cover the lid.
Let it boil, see that you do not need to fully cook the rice at this point.
Take them off when they are half done.
Drain the rice.
Masala for gosht (Chicken): Take a bowl, add yogurt, almond powder, ginger-garlic paste & salt.
Also add garam masala & kachri powder.
Mix them well & mix the chicken in it too.
Leave it for 1-2 hour.
Fry the onions (slice cut) & keep them for later use.
To Assemble Biryani: Take a cooking pot, add meat & yogurt in it.
Add fried onions with some oil (add half of the fried onions).
Add lemon juice.
Then add the rice on top of meat.
Now add the remaining fried onions with some oil.
Add saffron (zafraan) mixed milk & khoya.
Cover the lid & leave for 25 min to cook on slow heat.
After that the dish is ready.
Serve this biryani with raita.

recipes.name: Naan
instructions: Add yeast and sugar to warm water and put aside.
When yeast is raised to desired consistency, add plain flour, salt and milk or water and knead into fine dough.
Wrap with a plastic sheet and keep in a warm place for 2 to 3 hours.
Then roll out equal portions of the dough and bake in a pre heated oven at 200C for 8 to 10 minutes.
When you see a change in color, brush some butter on top and bake again for 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Roghni Naan
instructions: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water.
When yeast is raised, mix with plain flour, salt and butter.
Knead with milk or water and put aside for 2 - 3 hours.
Fold over kneaded dough using hands and divide into equal portions.
Roll each portion into a flat naan and make fork marks on it.
Bake in a pre heated oven at 200C for 8 - 10 minutes.
When naan turns into a nice golden brown color, brush with butter and bake for another couple of minutes.
Roghni naan is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Makkai Ki Roti
instructions: Take a bowl and put wheat flour and corn flour in it.
Now add salt and water (as you required) to knead it to make dough.
Now make medium balls from dough.
Roll into chapattis on a rolling board.
Pour some clarified butter or oil on tawa put roti.
Roast both the side of it and serve it.

recipes.name: Missi Paratha
instructions: Mix gram flour and red flour in a bowl.
Knead green chilies, onion, chopped coriander, turmeric, cumin, crushed coriander, tomatoes and salt with required amount of water to knead the dough.
When the dough gets ready add 2 tbsp clarified butter, mix well and keep aside for 10 to 15 minutes.
Make balls of the dough, roll it to form rotis.
Heat pan and fry roti with clarified butter.

recipes.name: Shermal
instructions: Take warm water in a cup and put yeast, sugar and mix.
Leave it for 10 to 15 minutes.
When its start to rise, put it in a mixing bowl with white flour, beaten egg, clarified butter and salt and knead it well.
Now wrap it in a plastic sheet and leave it on a warm place.
Now make balls from it and roll it with a rolling pin, with help of fork make marks in the centre.
Now put it in oven for baking for 15 to 18 minutes at 200C.
Brush sheermal with clarified butter and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Methi Palak Puri
instructions: Add salt and make past spinach and fenugreek mixture.
Now add cumin, red chili powder, all spice powder, flour, and oil.
Knead with warm water into a soft dough.
Make balls and set aside for 10 minutes.
Now roll out small puris and fry in hot oil.

recipes.name: Moong Dal Parathas
instructions: Put 1/2 tsp turmeric powder and chilli powder and 1 tbsp oil in the flour and make a dough.
In a vessel, heat 1 tsp oil, add ginger, green chillies, turmeric powder, coriander and chilli powder.
Add the lentils and put about 1, 1/2 cup of water and salt.
Cover and cook till the lentils are separated and tender and water has dried up.
Add pomegranate seeds in it.
Now make small balls of wheat flour and flatten them.
Put 1 tbsp cooked lentils in it, cover into a ball again.
Then roll like parathas and cook on a griddle, smearing it with oil frequently.

recipes.name: Chappati Filled With Mince & Eggs
instructions: Cook mince with red chili powder, ginger garlic paste, onions, green chilies, salt and water.
Cook till mince is tender and place aside.
Mix flour, wheat flour and salt with water. Leave this dough for 5 minutes.
Make small balls of this dough and roll each ball to almost 6 inches.
Place square Samosa Patti over it and place some mice mixture over it.
Place tomatoes, spring onion, all spice powder and chat masala.
Pour whipped egg half over it and cover with other rolled dough.
Cut square with the help of pastry wheel and shallow fry till its golden brown.

recipes.name: Khameeri Roti
ingredients: Clarified butter (ghee) to grease baking tray
instructions: Dissolved the yeast in 120 ml/half cup warm water.
Sieve the flour with salt onto a platter.
Make a well in the flour and pour 240 ml/1 cup water.
Mix flour and water gradually, then knead into a tough dough.
Cover with a damp cloth and keep aside for 15 minutes.
Slowly sprinkle the dissolved yeast over the dough and keep kneading till the dough is smooth and pliable and not sticky.
Cover with damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes.
Divide dough into 8 equal balls and dust with dry flour.
Press and flatten each ball into round discs, 8 inches wide.
Wearing an oven glove stick the disc to the side of a hot tandoor and bake for 2 minutes.
Remove with a pair of tongs.
Alternatively, place on a greased baking try and bake for 4-5 minutes in a preheated oven at 350°F.

recipes.name: Puran Poli
instructions: Clean and wash the gram dhal well.
Boil till it is tender and the water dries up.
If there is excess water, drain it off.
Add sugar to the cooked gram dhal and cook again.
Add ground cardamoms and whole cloves and cook till a thread like syrup is formed.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
Meanwhile sieve the flour and mix in about 2 tsp ghee.
Add a little water at a time and knead to a thick dough.
Knead well, divide into equal portions and roll into balls 2 inches in diameter. Keep on one side.
Next grind the gram mixture to a very thick paste and roll into the same number of balls as the flour balls in the palm of your hands.
The gram balls should be almost double the size of the flour balls.
Flatten out the flour balls and carefully stuff in the gram balls.
Seal carefully and roll our like the ordinary paratha.
Place on a tava and fry on both sides using as little ghee as possible.

recipes.name: Lentils with Eggplant
instructions: Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add onion and Garam Masala; sauté 3 minutes or until onion is tender.
Stir in tomato, turmeric, ginger, garlic, and eggplant; sauté 7 minutes or until eggplant is tender.
Add lentils, water, salt, and bay leaves to pan; bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes.
Discard bay leaves. Serve over rice.

recipes.name: Aam Dhal
instructions: Wash and soak the dhal for an hour.
Change the water, add salt and set to boil on a medium heat.
Peel the mangoes, cut into three pieces each and add to the half cooked dhal.
Cook till dhal is tender and the mangoes are cooked to a pulp.
Heat the ghee in a frying pan and fry the spices.
Add chopped onion and garlic and fry till brown.
Add to the cooked dhal.
Aam dhal should be of a watery consistency.
Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Mash Ki Daal
instructions: Wash and boil pulse when little water remain then add salt.
Add red chilli flakes, ginger garlic paste, cumin seed mix well and let it dry.
Put all spices powder, julien ginger, green chillies, coriander leaves.
Serve hot with naan and salad.

recipes.name: Dal Dhokli
ingredients: 1 cup arhar dal (soaked in a water for 1 hour)
instructions: In a cooker put dal, chilly paste, tomatoes and 1 glass water now give 4-5 whistle to it.
Now mash it little bit and add salt, groundnuts, 1/4 glass water and again make 4-5 whistle.
Now add 1/2 glass water in it and add curry leaves, haldi, coriander, lemon juice, sugar and keep for boiling on slow flame.
Now as 1-2 boiler comes add raw chappati pcs in dal and let it boil for atleast 10 min on slow flame by stiring it.
For garnishing -- take nonstick pan put 2 spoon oil add zeera, rai and hing as it turn in golden.
Now garnish this mixer and fresh coriander in dal mix well and serve hot.

recipes.name: Masala Toovar
ingredients: To be ground into a paste:
instructions: Clean, wash and soak the toovar in enough water overnight, add 2 1/2 cups of water and the whole onions and pressure cook for 2 to 3 whistles or till the toovar is cooked.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid. Keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the sliced onions and saute for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring continuously.
Add the ground paste and saute for another 3 to 4 minutes, while stirring continuously.
Add cooked toovar, 1 cup of water and salt, mix well and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring once in between.
Add the tomatoes and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipes.name: Khatta Urad Dal
ingredients: 1/2 cup sour curds (whisked with 1 cup of water)
instructions: Clean, wash and soak the chilkewali urad dal in water for about 15 minutes.
Drain and keep aside.
Drain, add 1 1/2 cups of water and pressure cook for at least 4 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Add all the remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipes.name: Sookhe Kabuli Chane
instructions: Soak the chickpeas overnight with bicarbonate of soda.
Next morning, boil the chickpeas with the tea bag in plenty of water, on low heat, till tender and the water nearly dries up.
Discard the tea bag.
Add all the dry spices, salt, fried potato fingers, and ginger, toss well.
Heat the oil in a pan, add the chickpea mixture, and toss on low heat for about 10 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with green chillies, dry red chilies, and onions rings.

recipes.name: Rajistani Punch Rangi Daal
instructions: Wash and soak all 'Dals' in water for 2 hours.
Then boil them in saltish water until tender.
Cut in pieces green chilies and coriander leaves. Thinly slice ginger.
In a pan heat oil and fry in it cumin, cloves, dry red chilies and turmeric. When reddish brown then add ginger and green chilies also in this pan and fry for a while.
Now add to this coriander powder and red chilies and stir-fry for a minute.
Now add tomatoes and stir-fry until oil is separated.
To this pan add 'daals' (lentils) while stirring. Mix all well and cook on low flame for few minutes then put off the flame.
Serve hot with rice or as soup.

recipes.name: White Lentils with Spinach
instructions: Heat oil and add the garlic cloves.
Fry till golden brown.
Put in the lentils with spinach and spices.
Do not add water, cook on low heat till lentils are tender.
Steam for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Sprouted Lentil Curry
instructions: Soak the lentil seeds overnight. Next morning, drain and remove them from the bowl.
Put them in a vessel with a tight fitting lid and place in a warm place with a fairly heavy weight on the lid.
By evening they well have sprouted.
Put the sprouted lentils in plenty of water and leave overnight.
Next morning drain the water and remove the outer skins.
Now put a saucepan containing 2 pints water to boil.
When it has boiled add the lentil seeds.
When they are half cooked, drop in a few cashew nuts and cook the mixture till tender.
Add salt. Grind coconut with red chilies and tamarind to a smooth paste.
Fry the fenugreek in the coconut oil till it turns red and grind it with the paste.
Then pour all the ground spices into the lentils, bring to the boil and let cook for 5 more minutes.
Remove from heat. Chop onions, fry in ghee to a golden brown and drop in the curry.
Serve with green chutney.

recipes.name: Moong Dal
instructions: Soak the split green gram in cold water for 20 minutes, drain, place in a pan along with the water, turmeric and salt and bring to a boil.
Remove the scum which forms while boiling as it adds an unpleasant taste.
Simmer until the split green gram is soft, stir it with a ladle, pressing it against the sides of the pan to break it without making it mushy.
Stir in the lemon juice and green chillies.
Pour into a serving dish.

Heat the ghee in a pan and fry the cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon, garlic and ginger until they release their aromas, add the tomatoes, saute briefly, and pour the contents of the pan over the hot moong dal.
Cover and allow the aromas to infuse for a few minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves.

recipes.name: Yellow Moong Dal
instructions: Wash the husked green beans; then soak them in cold water for 30 minutes. Drain.
Boil the beans in a pan, with the water, turmeric and salt, till they are soft, stirring gently so that they don't break.
Heat the ghee in a small pan, fry ginger and garlic, add the tomatoes and saute them till they are reduced.
Add to the beans, and cover to infuse the aromas.
Stir green chillies and coriander leaves into the beans.

recipes.name: Chanay Ki Daal Karela
instructions: Dry roast together coriander seeds, fennel seeds, onion seeds, white cumin seeds and grind finely, keep aside.
Boil lentil till slightly tender, peel and sliced bitter gourd.
Heat oil fry, sliced onion till light golden.
Add ginger garlic paste, turmeric, salt, chilli powder, fry well.
Add yogurt, fry well.
Now add boiled gram lentil with sliced bitter gourd.
Mix well, simmer for 10 minutes.
Lastly sprinkle the dry roasted masala and all spice.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and green chillies.

recipes.name: Saboth Masoor Dhal
ingredients: Kayri slices (unripe mango) as to taste
instructions: Soak the lentil for 3 hours.
Put it on stove and cook for 30-40 minutes on low heat.
Add garlic paste, turmeric, red pepper and salt.
Cook for a while.
Also add few slices of kayri.
Cook the lentil for a while.
For Baghar: Take oil in a pan.
Then add onion in it, and saute them for a while.
Add cumin, garlic, black pepper, salt and corriander.
Also green chillies in it.
Fry them all for a while.
Then add them in the prepared lentil.
You can garnish with fresh corriander and serve it with cumin rice.

recipes.name: Shahjahani Dhal
ingredients: 1 lb split peas or gram dhal
instructions: Set the dhal or peas to boil, when parboiled, take off the heat.
Heat the ghee in a saucepan and when it has begun to smoke, fry the garam masala (cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon) for 1/2 minute.
Add the thinly sliced onions and fry to a golden brown.
Add the dhal, cover and cook for about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, grate half the coconut and extract the milk by boiling in a little water.
Strain this milk and mix with the dhal.
When the coconut milk has almost evaporated add the cream and salt.
Chop the other half of the coconut into small cubes, fry slightly and add to the dhal.
Put in the sliced green chilies and keep stirring till the dhal has a dry, thickish consistency. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Strawberry Surprise
instructions: Add strawberries, white drink, ice, caster sugar and lemon juice powder in a blender and blend well till smooth.
Serve, decorate with mint leaves.

recipes.name: Lemony Peachy Surprise
instructions: In a blender add peaches, lemon juice powder, ice, caster sugar, black salt and white drink and blend them well.
Serve, decorate with peach wedges.

recipes.name: Electric Lemonade
ingredients: Non-alcoholic blue curacao or blue color
instructions: In a pan add water, sugar and salt cook till sugar dissolved, remove keep aside to cool.
When sugar syrup completely cooled add in non-alcoholic blue curacao and lemon juice.
Add curacao as much till required blue color.
Add 7-up in equal quantity of lemonade for balanced taste.
Pour into glass, add lemon slices and ice cubes ready to serve.

recipes.name: Cucumber Cocktail
instructions: Peel the cucumber and take out the seeds.
In the blender, add in cucumber, ice cream soda, sugar, lemon juice and ice.
Blend everything together.
Pour then in glasses and serve.

recipes.name: Fruit Mocktail
instructions: Mix apple juice, pomegranate juice, pineapple juice and tangerine juice in a jug.
Squeeze lemon in it and add sugar.
Pour mocktail in glasses.
Serve with mint leaves and ice.

recipes.name: Pina Colada
instructions: In an electric blender, blend ice, pineapple juice, milk, cream, sugar and coconut milk powder.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve chilled.

recipes.name: Watermelon Slush
instructions: Place the ice cubes into a blender.
Cover and pulse until crushed.
Add the watermelon and blend for about 1 minute, until slushy.
Add the honey and blend for about 10 seconds.

recipes.name: Date Lemon Water
instructions: Take a saucepan and put water and dates and boil it for 10 minutes.
Then turn the heat off and add honey and lemon juice. Mix well.
Then keep aside for 10 – 12 hour.
Strain it and serve cold.

recipes.name: Orange Fiesta
instructions: Blend together orange juice, soda water, black pepper, black salt, lemon juice and mint leaves.
Pour into glasses and serve with ice.

recipes.name: Jasmine Lemonade Cocktail
instructions: Add 3 to 4 cups of water in a saucepan and put jasmine leaves into it.
Cook it for 3 to 4 minutes.
Now strain and put it in blender along with soda, ice cube, salt and lemon juice.
Blend well pour into glasses and serve chilled.

recipes.name: Bhapa Doi
instructions: Beat the curd well and gradually mix in the condensed milk.
Then pour the mixture in a bowl or aluminum dish with a tight lid and place it in a saucepan with water coming to a little less than half the depth of the bowl.
Boil gently for 1 hour. Chill and serve.

recipes.name: Mysore Pak
instructions: Add a little water to the sugar and melt it to syrup.
Now add 6 tbsp ghee and, after a few minutes, gram flour and the remaining ghee.
Stir on a medium heat, thoroughly and continuously so as to avoid sticking.
As the mixture melts and the ghee begins to appear on the surface, remove and pour the contents on to a greased thali and sprinkle with cardamom.
Let cool and then cut into 1-inch squares.

recipes.name: Strawberry Shrikhand
instructions: Spoon yogurt into a clean cheese cloth, tie into a knot and suspend the 'pouch' from your kitchen faucet for 4-5 hours OR place in a colander with a bowl underneath and keep in the refrigerator.
Remove the drained, thick yogurt into a mixing bowl.
Slice the stems off the berries, halve them and put in a blender.
Pulse for a few minutes.
Strain the pulp to get a smooth syrup and add to yogurt.
Stir in sugar and whisk the mixture until it dissolves.
A hand blender works well here.
Peel the cardamoms and crush to a fine powder in a mortar and pestle.
Add to yogurt and whisk again.
Cover and chill shrikhand until it is ready to serve.
Sprinkle with pistachios and almonds before serving.

recipes.name: Besan and Sooji ka Halwa
ingredients: Almonds and pistachios finely chopped as required for garnish
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan; add the cardamom seeds when hot.
Then add sooji and besan, lower heat and cook stirring continuously.
Remove from the pan. Combine 1⁄2 cup water and sugar in the pan and cook for five minutes or till the sugar dissolves completely.
Add the besan and sooji to sugar syrup and cook stirring constantly, add raisins, continue to stir, then add milk and stir till the milk is mixed in thoroughly.
Apply a little ghee to a large platter and spread the halwa in it.
Garnish with almonds and pistachios. Cut in pieces when cool.

recipes.name: Monthal
instructions: Cook milk with sugar and cardamoms and prepare syrup.
Now separately, heat clarified oil and gram flour.
Add coconut, poppy seeds, almonds and mix.
Then take the mixture off the flame and pour syrup on it.
Stir together with a wooden spoon.
Grease a tray, put the mixture on it, sprinkle remaining coconut, almonds and poppy seeds on top and serve.

recipes.name: Badami Halwa
instructions: In a pan heat clarified butter.
Now add green cardamom to crackle.
Then add sugar and almond paste to cook.
Then put solid milk and cook till oil separates.
Dish it out and garnish with almond and serve.

recipes.name: Egg Halwa
instructions: Whip the eggs in a bowl.
Now add in sugar and milk and beat again.
Heat ghee in a skillet, add cardamom and fry till the seeds begin to sizzle.
Then add the egg mixture, fry till the ghee comes on top Lower the flame and add yellow food color mixed in cold milk. Mix well.
When the aroma of the halwa is given out then add 1tbsp mixed seeds, saffron and few drops of kewra essence.
Dish out the egg halwa and garnish with almonds, pistachio and silver leaves.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Halwa
instructions: Wash sweet potato and then boil in sufficient water.
Remove skin and mash it.
Heat ghee in a pan and sizzle cardamom then add mashed sweet potato.
After 5 minutes, add milk and cook. When milk is near to dry then add sugar.
When sugar is completely dissolved and milk dries. Remove from heat and serve.

recipes.name: Khopra Halwa
instructions: In a pan add semolina to sauté. Keep aside.
In a separate pan add milk, cardamom and sugar to cook.
Dissolve green food color in water and add in milk pan.
Now add solid milk to cook and stir continuously.
Now add sauté semolina and cook till it turn thick.
Now take it out in a mould and garnish with coconut to serve.

recipes.name: Bread Halwa
instructions: Separate the sides of bread slices and make breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and fry breadcrumbs until its color becomes golden brown.
Then add milk and sugar in it.
When milk dries up then add cream.
Beat eggs in another bowl and fry with little clarified butter.
Then mix in halwa.
Add dry nuts and roast for a while.
Delicious bread halwa is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Lauki ka Halwa
instructions: Peel off the skin of a bottle gourd and grate finely.
In a wok, add oil, 1 tsp sugar and ground cardamoms.
When spices become fragrant, add grated bottle gourd and a pinch of green food color.
Mix together briefly and take off the flame.
In the same wok, add sugar and 1⁄2 cup water and cook to form sugar syrup.
Add prepared sugar syrup to bottle gourd and mix.
Grease a tray and place bottle gourd Halva on it.
Sprinkle milk solid, ground coconut and almonds on top and serve.

recipes.name: Date and Chickpea Halwa
instructions: Blend the dates into a blender and take it out.
Boil chickpeas in milk and make paste of it.
Now put clarified butter into pan and heat it up, then put batter in it and cook it on low heat for 10 minutes.
Add sugar, cardamom powder into pan and cook it for 5 minutes.
Put dates into the pan and cook 5 minutes more.
Dish it out and garnish it with almond and pistachio.

recipes.name: Aloo Ka Halwa
instructions: First mash the potato and put it on a side.
Take a pan and heat up clarified butter and add clove and cardamom, sauté it.
Now add mash potato with sugar and cook it well.
When it turn light brown, dish it out and garnish it with silver paper.

recipes.name: Walnut Halwa
ingredients: Slivered almonds and pistachios as required
instructions: Heat oil in a wok and fry small cardamoms.
When the aroma is given off add chopped and peeled walnuts.
Fry for 1-2 minutes.
Then add 1 cup khoya, sugar and fried semolina.
Cook for a further 5-10 minutes.
Grease a tray and spread the halwa.
Sprinkle the khoya and slivered pistachios and almonds on top.

recipes.name: Akhroti Kalakand
instructions: Make paste of walnut and almond.
Heat oil in pan and add cottage cheese, walnut and almond paste and icing sugar and cook it well.
When oil starts to make separate layer, add dry milk and cook.
Now take it out in a square mould and garnish it with walnut and cool it.
Now cut it and serve it.

recipes.name: Suji Aur Orange ka Halwa
instructions: In a skillet roast semolina.
In ghee add green cardamom with sugar.
When it get bubbles then add semolina, orange slices, orange juice and yellow food color mix it and stir with spoon.
When the halwa is fried then add few drops of kewra essence and turn off the flame.
In the end garnishe with orange wheels.

recipes.name: Khashkhash Halwa
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup milk solid or dry milk
instructions: Soak the poppy seeds in water overnight.
Next day, wash well and remove the excess water.
Put it in a mixer and grind to a soft paste by adding little milk or coconut water.
In a karahi add clarified butter and heat it.
When it is warm, add the poppy seeds paste and stir well.
Stir continuously till the raw smell of the poppy seeds go away and it turns to light brown.
Add milk and stir continuously till the paste absorbs all the milk and the paste is thick.
Add milk solid or dry milk along with sugar and coconut.
Stir continuously till it becomes thick and leaves sides of the karahi.
Add cardamom powder, almond and raisin.
Mix well and transfer it to a greased tray, spread it and cool.
When it is cool, cut it into desired shape.

recipes.name: Moung Daal Halwa
instructions: Soak split lentil for 1 hour.
Grind the split lentil to fine paste, keep it aside.
Heat the clarified butter in a sauce pan & put the ground lentil paste, sauté it on low flame till it turns golden & leave the sides of the pan.
Put water and sugar in a pan, allow boiling on low flame.
Keep stirring the spoon till the sugar get dissolved into the water & become syrup.
Shift the lentils paste mixture into the sugar syrup & cook on low flame until the lentils & sugar syrup combined together.
Remove it from the flame, garnish with the mix dry fruit from top.

recipes.name: Peanut Halwa
instructions: Firstly crush the peanuts and roast them in a pan.
Now add milk and let it cook.
When the milk reduces to half in quantity add sugar and stir until it dissolve.
Lastly add the milk solid.
Stir and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Garnish with pistachios and almonds.

recipes.name: Chany Ki Daal Ka Halwa
instructions: Boil the gram lentils in milk till it dries and the lentils tender.
Allow the lentils to cool then blend it.
Heats clarified butter in a pan and add crushed cardamoms along with the ground lentils and fry well for at least half an hour till light brown.
Then add in sugar and continue to cook, the halva looks thin at this time, keep frying well till it leaves clarified butter at the sides of the pan.
Add solid milk and fry for another 10-15 minutes.
Serve in a flat platter.
Sprinkle almonds and pistachios.
Top with silver paper and cut into pieces.

recipes.name: Karachi Halwa
instructions: Put water and corn flour in a pan as per required, mixed it well.
Light the flame and stir the mixture with a spoon.
When the mixture get thick then add a little clarified butter.
After that, when mixture shaped as a layer then add citric acid, kewra essence and red colour mixed it properly.
Now add half cup dried melon seeds in a mixture.
Grease the tray with clarified butter and spread the mixture on it.
Sprinkled dried melon seeds and placed it in fridge for cooling.
Karachi halwa is ready.

recipes.name: Habshi Halwa
instructions: Boil milk into a pan.
Mix tartri and one cup water in a bowl.
Now mix this mixture in milk, move spoon.
After 5 minutes when milk spoils, add food color, sugar and grape vinegar and mix again.
Mix 1 cup water into white flour and adds it into milk batter and blends it.
Now put 1⁄2 cup of clarified butter into it.
Now put it on stove and mix it with spoon continuously.
When water dries from the pan, add remaining clarified butter into it.
When aroma arise from the pan, take it out from pan and spread it into a tray to cool down.
When Halwa become cool cut into pieces and garnish it with dry fruit.

recipes.name: Gondh Ka Halwa
instructions: In a skillet put clarified butter and fry gum in it and set aside.
Now in the same clarified butter add almonds, pistachio, walnuts, sesame and mix seeds, fry well and set aside.
Now preheat a griddle, place whole wheat flour flatbread and crumble them.
Then crush dry fruit and gum (gondh).
Now add flatbread crumbs, ground dry fruit and sugar in mixing bowl.
Now mix all ingredients in same clarified butter.
Then add milk and cook well.
Take out in dish and serve.

recipes.name: Caramel Halwa
instructions: In a pan stir continuously sugar and cardamoms on a medium flame till melts and turn golden brown.
Beat eggs separately.
In a separate bowl, add semolina and milk mix them well.
Then add mixture of eggs in it and mix it well.
Then add melted sugar in the whole mixture and stir it continuously on low flame until oil separates.
Garnish with sliced almonds and serve.

recipes.name: Ratalu Halwa
instructions: Boil sweet potatoes, skin and mash.
Add milk and cook stirring till it becomes a thick paste.
Keep aside. Make a syrup of sugar.
When it becomes one string consistency, add the cooked sweet potato.
Cook, adding the ghee every 2 minutes.
Add the grated coconut, crushed cardamom, essence, khoya and cook well.
When it starts leaving the pan, pour into a greased tray.
Garnish with nuts and cut into diamond shapes and serve.

recipes.name: Khoya Seviyan Vermicelli
instructions: Boil one packet of vermicelli in hot water for one minute.
Then take it out of water.
Heat ghee in a pan till it starts giving crackling sound, now add vermicelli to it.
After frying it for one to two minutes, add khoya and fresh cream.
Fry again for one to two minutes.
Unify khoya and cream well after frying.
Now add sugar and cardamom powder to it.
After cooking it for a few minutes, add thinly chopped pistachios, almonds and kewra essence.
Your delicious Khoya Vermicelli is ready, milk is not used in it.
Garnish with chopped almonds, walnuts and fresh cream.
Chef's tip: A little saffron can also be used to improve fragrance and flavour.

recipes.name: Raj Tukray
instructions: Apply butter on bread slices and toast in oven from both sides until golden brown.
Arrange bread slices in a wide serving bowl.
On other side add sugar and saffron in milk and cook. Then remove from heat and add cream, put on heat and cook little more.
Pour milk over bread slices.
Heat oil in pan and stir fry dry fruits for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle over bread and serve.

recipes.name: Kimami Sevai
instructions: For Kimami: Take a heavy bottom pan add 1 liter of milk bring boil then add sugar mix and now cook string spoon on medium heat to dry milk and reduced, kimam is ready.
In a pan add 2 tbsp of clarified butter and fry sewai/vermicelli till golden brown and aroma comes, take out vermicelli and keep aside.
Fry makhana in same pan and take out set a side.
Now chop all nuts finely and grind soaked coconut and dry dates coarsely keep aside.
Now take heavy bottom pan add remaining clarified butter, green cardamom and cloves, splutter them add solid milk and fry it until brown.
Now add ground coconut and dry dates fry them till color changes to brown.

Add kimam, chopped nuts and makhana also add fried sewai and 1⁄2 liter remaining milk stir on medium heat when bubbles starts, cover and simmer on low flame for about 4-5 minutes. (Do not overcook and dry the syrup)
Dish out and sprinkle desiccated coconut garnish silver paper and serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Chow Mein
ingredients: 3 tsp black pepper or up to taste
1/4 cup chili sauce or to taste
1/4 cup tomato sauce or up to taste
1/4 cup soy sauce or up to your taste
instructions: For Boil Chicken: Get a saucepan and pour 4 cups water, then add the garlic and ginger paste add the chicken when water gets its first boil.
Keep checking every 10 minutes to see if the chicken is cooked or not.
For Boil Spaghetti: Add 9 cups of water to another saucepan and wait for it to boil completely. Then add the spaghetti with the salt and oil, so they don't stick together.
Get a large fry pan and add the vegetables, chicken and spaghetti together. Add the black pepper, chili sauce, tomato sauce, soy sauce and mix until all the ingredients are combined together.
At the end if you want get the eggs and whisk them to together. After that fry it and break into pieces and spread over the spaghetti.

recipes.name: Chicken Manchurian
ingredients: A pinch of red food colour
instructions: Cut chicken breast in to cubes, marinate it in soya sauce, vinegar, salt and black pepper. Leave it for 30 minutes.
Now heat oil in a wok and add garlic to saute, add marinated chicken and cook it until water dries.
Add tomato puree in it and simmer for a while then add chicken stock, chopped onion and capsicum.
Cook it well then add vinegar, soya sauce, red chilli, salt, tomato ketchup and red food colour, mix it well and cook to come boiling point.
Dissolve some corn flour in water and add corn flour to sauce to make a thick gravy keep the flame high.
Check the consistency of gravy; now pour the gravy in serving dish and serve it with fried rice.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Chow Mein
instructions: Boil noodles along with oil.
When the noodles are boiled drain the water and wash them with cold water.
Grease them and keep them.
Now marinate undercut with 1 tbsp soya sauce, 1 tbsp white vinegar and salt and keep it for 10 minutes.
Heat oil and add in garlic cloves.
Fry it till they are golden brown.
Add in the meat and stir fry it.
Add in carrots, capsicum, brown sugar, 1 tbsp soya sauce, 1 tbsp white vinegar and black pepper.
Cook it and add in the noodles.
Add in pine apple cubes.
Add in sesame seed oil.
Dish it out and serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Hakka Noodles
instructions: Grind red chilies, ginger and garlic.
Heat oil in a pan, add the chili paste and sauté for a minute.
Now add capsicum and carrot. Fry till it tenders.
Put spring onion and stir fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add in soya sauce and chicken pieces and toss well.
Now add noodles and salt (to taste) and mix well.
Add vinegar and mix it well.
Hakka Noodles is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Spicy Fried Rice
instructions: Wash and soak rice and boil them along with 1 tbsp white vinegar and salt.
Boil them for 5 minutes and drain the water.
Take some oil in the pan, add in chopped garlic and fry it till golden brown.
Add in some yellow food color in the eggs along with 1 tsp red chili flakes.
Beat them and keep on moving the spoon quickly.
When the egg it fried cut it into pieces and keep it aside.
Stir fry carrot, capsicum and mushroom.
Add in 1 tbsp white vinegar, soya sauce and brown sugar.
Add in the rice and mix everything.
Add in sesame seed oil.
Take it out in dish and garnish with eggs and spring onion leaves.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chinese Chicken Noodles
instructions: Heat oil in a pot and cook chicken on high flame till color changes.
Add all vegetables and fry for 1 minute.
Add remaining ingredients except noodles, mix and remove from flame.
Add boiled noodles, mix well and serve.

recipes.name: Stir Fried Chinese Chicken
instructions: Boil chicken in 1 cup water.
Turn the flame off when only 1⁄2 cup chicken stock is left.
In a wok, heat oil and fry cloves of garlic.
When aroma is given off, add spring onion, fried onion, mushroom, capsicum, red chili and peas.
Cook on high flame for 1 minute.
Then add sesame oil, peanut butter, chili sauce, soya sauce, salt, tomato paste and black vinegar mix well then turn the flame off.
Stir fry Chinese chicken is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Corn Soup
instructions: Wash the chicken bones, boil them in 3 cups of water along with the black pepper corns, garlic cloves, and bay leaves when cooked fully strain the stock.
In a separate sauce pan boil together the stock and corn.
When uniformly mixed add the shredded chicken fillet, salt and white pepper powder.
Mix corn flour and 1tbsp chicken flour in water and stir into the stock.
When the mixture thickens turn the flame off.
After 5 minutes beat the eggs into the soup.
Heat sesame oil and pour into the soup.
Serve with vinegar, Soya sauce, green chilies and chili sauce.

recipes.name: Chinese Soup
ingredients: 4 topped, tailed and sliced spring onions
170 gm defrosted and shredded seafood sticks
Salt and black pepper as required
instructions: Take the chicken stock in a saucepan and bring to the boil.
Add the sweet corn kernels, ginger, spring onions, seafood sticks and prawns.
Add the salt, black pepper.
Blend the corn flour in a small bowl with enough cold water to form a smooth paste.
Stir the corn flour paste into the soup and simmer gently for 5 minutes.
Stir until slightly thickened.
Serve hot garnished with carrot flowers.

recipes.name: Black Pepper Chicken
ingredients: 400 gm boneless chicken (cut into 1/2 inch dices)
3 medium onions (cut into medium size cubes)
instructions: Mix well all the sauce ingredients in a bowl.
On chicken, sprinkle corn flour and deep fry just for 2-3 minutes.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a wok, add onions and fry till half done.
Add garlic and sauce ingredients.
After a minute add fried chicken cubes.
Add capsicum and cook for another 2 minutes on high flame.
Serve hot with plain rice.

recipes.name: Garlic Cauliflower
instructions: Cut cauliflower in florets.
Take corn flour and all purpose flour in a bowl.
Then add salt, soy sauce, vinegar and red chili powder in it. Mix well.
Add a little water in it to form a thick batter.
Now sprinkle salt on cauliflower.
After 15 minutes, dip cauliflower in batter and deep fry till golden.
Cut whole red chilli into pieces and mix cornflour in chicken stock.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and add garlic.
Then add whole red chillies with ketchup and mix well.
Now add salt, soy sauce and a little water.
when it simmers, then dissolve corn flour and mix well.
Let it simmer, then add vinegar.
Now add spring onion and remove from heat.
Serve hot with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Szechuan Soup
ingredients: A pinch of red food color
instructions: Cut the boneless chicken into small pieces.
Also, cut the carrot and cabbage into small pieces.
Chop the spring onion and crush Szechuan peppercorn.
Mix the corn starch in a quarter cup of water, along with salt, vinegar, red chili paste and Szechuan pepper.
Heat the chicken stock and put carrot, cabbage, spring onion and capsicum, cook on high heat.
Now gradually add the corn starch mixture in a thin stream while stirring slowly in one direction.
Bring to boil and add chicken and pinch of red food color.
Stir and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken with Mushroom
instructions: Marinate chicken pieces with salt, corn flour and 1 tbsp oil, and set aside.
Heat 5 tbsp oil in a wok, fry chicken pieces and remove.
Fry ginger garlic in the same oil.
Add chicken pieces, chilli sauce, soy sauce, stock, salt and cook for 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms, cook for few minutes and remove.

recipes.name: Lamb with Garlic Sauce
ingredients: 50 gm whole red chillies (break from the center)
1⁄2 cup corn flour (dissolved in required water to make paste)
Corn flour for coating as required
instructions: Cut meat into long and thin strips.
Heat oil in frying pan.
Coat meat strips with corn flour, fry and keep aside.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan.
Saute red chillies and garlic in it till golden.
Add capsicums, carrot and cabbage and fry on high flame, add meat.
Add tomato ketchup, salt and stock.
Add dissolved corn flour in a thin stream, stirring continuously, until gravy thickens.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add chopped capsicum, carrots, crushed black pepper, salt, chicken cubes and eggs. Mix well until egg cooked.
Add the boiled rice along with small amount of water, cover the pan and reduce the flame to simmer rice.
After 5 minutes dish out and serve.

recipes.name: Kebabs with Vegetables
instructions: In a bowl, mix together chicken mince, black pepper, socked bread slices, ginger garlic paste and salt.
Then form the mixture into long kebabs.
In a pan, heat oil and fry kebabs.
When kebabs are done, add capsicum, onion and green chilies after finely chopping them and fry them for a minute.
Also add tomato ketchup, soya sauce and vinegar and turn off the flame.
Delicious Chinese Kebab with Vegetables is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Ginger Chicken
ingredients: 2 tbsp corn flour (mixed in a little water)
instructions: Add chicken, white pepper, corn flour, salt and pepper to taste, egg and ginger water in a mixing bowl.
Mix well and set aside for while.
Now heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken pieces one by one till golden.
Now in the same oil add minced garlic, ginger slices and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Then add stock, white pepper, salt and pepper to taste, ginger, Soya sauce.
Bring it to a gentle boil and add fried chicken pieces.
Immediately pour corn flour mixture into the chicken while stirring continuously.
Simmer on gentle heat until the sauce thickens.
Turn the flame off and garnish with spring onion.
The ginger chicken is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Wings
instructions: In a mixing bowl mix ginger garlic paste, soya sauce, brown sugar, corn flour, black pepper crushed, egg white, chicken cube and salt to taste. Marinate chicken wings in the mixture.
Heat oil on medium flame to deep fry the chicken wings.
When wings are tender dish out and serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Balls
instructions: Combine minced chicken, egg, salt, black pepper, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste, corn flour and all purpose flour in a bowl and mix well.
Make small balls of the mixture and fry them in hot oil.
Heat oil in a pan and fry 1 tsp garlic ginger paste in it.
Add shallots, tomato ketchup, vinegar, salt and black pepper, saute.
Add chicken balls to it, mix.
Serve hot.
Tips: If a dish is over salted, put a handful of kneaded dough in it. It will absorb extra salt.

recipes.name: Hong Kong Chicken
instructions: Mix 2 1/2 tbsp corn flour with salt, white pepper, soaked ground Kashmir chili and egg in a bowl.
Marinate chicken in this mixture for 30 minutes.
Deep fry the chicken pieces till light golden.
Heat a little oil in a wok and add chopped ginger and garlic, saute for a while.
Now add chopped red chilies, chili sauce, fried chicken and chicken stock.
Bring it to a boil and then add vinegar.
Thicken the gravy with 1 1/2 tbsp corn flour mixed in a little stock.
Serve garnished with spring onions and sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Beef Chili Dry
instructions: Cut meat in small pieces and marinate it in papaya and garlic paste for 1⁄2 an hour.
De-seed the green chilies.
Heat oil in pan and add marinated meat, black pepper, salt to taste, sugar and oyster sauce and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Now add stock in it and cook till it thickens.
Now add chillies and cook a little and dish it out.
Garnish it with carrot and spring onion and serve hot with fried rice.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Manchurian
instructions: Make a paste of flour, corn flour, salt, ginger garlic paste and water.
Dip cauliflower in this paste and deep fry till golden brown and crisp.
Drain out and keep aside.
Heat up oil in a pan and fry chopped garlic till golden brown.
Add onion and green chilies. Fry for 1 minute.
Add soya sauce, ketchup, vinegar in it.
Mix fried cauliflower in this mixture in mix them.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

recipes.name: Cashew Chicken
instructions: Mix soya sauce, corn flour and salt in a bowl.
Heat oil in a pot and fry chicken till it changes colour.
Add peas, mushrooms and stock and cook for 5 minutes.
Add soya sauce mixture and cook till it thickens.
Garnish with spring onions and cashew nuts and serve.

recipes.name: Prawns Chow Mein with Pineapple
instructions: Fry the prawns in oil.
Then fry all vegetables in oil.
After that add pineapple juice, soy sauce and sesame oil.
After that add cornflour to thicken the sauce.
Then add noodles and mix well.
Be careful not to mix hardly as it may break the noodles.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: 200 gm chicken meat breast bone less
instructions: Cut the chicken meat into 1 inch cube.
Marinade with soya sauce, sesame oil, and corn flour. Leave it for 15 minutes.
While the chicken is marinating, prepare the sauce & vegetable's, in a bowl, combine Soya sauce, white vinegar and set a side.
Cut small red chilies, in half, so they are same size as chicken cubes. Remove the seed's, peel garlic cloves, chop them.
Cut the green onions into thin slice.
Now heat the wok over medium high flame.
Add oil, when the oil get hot, add the chicken, stir-fry until it turn white & is 80 percent cooked.
Remove from the wok.
Add 02 table spoon oil, when the oil get hot, add chopped garlic, Stir-fry until aromatic, about 30 second,
Now add the red chilies crushed, black pepper, and the sauce to the wok, bring to boil, add the chicken back into the wok
Stir it in pea-nut's & the green onion.
Remove from the heat, put in a few drops of sesame oil.

recipes.name: Prawns in Hoisin Sauce
instructions: Wash and clean the prawns and set aside.
Heat the wok and pour in the oil.
Saute minced ginger, garlic, and dry chilli for five seconds.
Add prawns and stir for 15 seconds over low flame.
Add the remaining vegetables and toss.
Pour hoising sauce and chicken stock and let it boil.
Simmer for about one minute; add salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with leeks.

recipes.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
instructions: Boil rice and then pour cold water over them.
Sieve and set aside.
Finely cut capsicum, cabbage, carrots and onions in the same size.
Put ginger/garlic paste and vegetables in a pot and fry them slightly.
Add rice to the fried vegetables and mix well.
Add soya sauce, salt and white pepper powder in the rice and mix well.
Serve solo or with a curry of your choice.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Prawns
instructions: For Prawns: Chop prawns roughly.
Beat egg put salt, black pepper, soya sauce, milk, flour, cornflour mix well.
In a bowl put prawns and add egg mixture and marinate.
Heat oil in a wok.
Take a large spoon and fill it with marinated prawn with thick mixture and put in oil.
Deep fry prawns till golden brown take out and keep a side.
For Sauce: Heat oil add carrot and stir fry.
Put water, stock cubes, ketchup and let it cook.
Then add sugar, vinegar and soya sauce cook more for a minute.
Add fried prawns in prepared sauce.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Spring Roll
ingredients: 400 grams chicken: cubes cut into a centimeter cube pieces
A whole bunch finely chopped spring onions
2 tbsp or more to taste soya sauce
1 bunch (hand full) finely chopped green coriander leaves
Salt to taste (not more because it's got soy sauce already in it)
instructions: Heat the oil in the pan and when its heated put the chicken cubes into it
Fry it for 5 minutes then put soy sauce, salt, black pepper, red chili flakes, red chili powder.
Now cook it for 15 Min.
After its cooked remove it from the wok and let it get cool.
Now add the finely chopped spring onion and the coriander, mix it well and fill it into the pastry sheets to make spring rolls.
Deep fry them on high heat for 3 to 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Chicken Shashlik
instructions: Cut chicken into medium size cubes.
Also cut capsicum, onion, tomatoes into medium size pieces.
Add garlic paste, sauces spices and oil to it.
Thread chicken pieces, capsicum, onion cubes and a tomato piece onto soaked skewer.
Heat oil in a pan and saute these sticks until tender.

recipes.name: Chicken with Vegetables and Garlic Soya Sauce
ingredients: 250 grams boneless chicken breast (cut in strips)
Small piece cut julienne style ginger
instructions: Place water in bottom of stove-top steamer.
Place chicken strips in single file on bottom of steamer for 15 minutes until no longer pink.
In second layer place squash, carrots, mushrooms and peanuts for 3-4 minutes then put onion rings, capsicum and ginger on top of first layer of vegetables for 2-3 more minutes.
Add cucumber to the vegetables for 2 minutes and remove onto serving plate.
In a frying pan on medium heat put cooking oil and fry garlic until lightly golden brown.
Add soya sauce, water, chicken cube, ginger and boil for 1 minute.
Add corn flour paste, cook for 1-2 minutes until thickens then place the sauce on top of the chicken and garnish with sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Szechwan Prawns
instructions: Clean the prawns and wash them.
Then cut slits in prawns about 1⁄2 cm apart.
Pour oil in a deep pan, add chopped ginger and garlic, also add prawns to it.
Now chop capsicum, red chillies, carrot, green shallots leaves and put them in the pan.
Add black pepper, white pepper, Worcestershire sauce, garlic chutney and ketchup.
Then add half cup of water and cook it for 3 to 4 minutes.
Now add water and corn flour mixture to thicken the sauce.
The delicious prawns are ready.
Garnish it with thin slices of green chilli and ginger.
Tip: Dry the pan before pouring ghee into it, otherwise the ghee will sizzle.

recipes.name: Chicken Rice Flower Dumplings
instructions: Pick, wash and soak rice in water for twenty minutes.
Drain and keep aside.
Wash green chillies, remove stem and chop them fine.
Peel and wash ginger.
Grind ginger into a fine paste.
Mix chicken mince with chopped green chillies, ginger paste, salt and crushed pepper corn.
Divide this mixture into twelve equal portions.
From round balls from each portion of chicken mix and then roll them in presoaked rice.
Place rice rolled chicken balls on a perforated rack which can be fitted into a steamer pot.
Boil water in the steamer pot and place the perforated rack in it.
Cover the pot. Steam for about fifteen to twenty minutes or untill cooked.
Remove gently and serve hot with a dip of your choice.

recipes.name: Prawn Shrimp Tempura
instructions: Shell and devein the prawns.
Leave the tails on for presentation. Make 3 slant cuts in each prawn to keep from shrinking.
Marinate them with salt, garlic and white pepper and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
To make the batter, sift both flours together in a bowl.
Add egg and soda water to make the thick paste and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.
In a wok, heat cooking oil on medium heat for 3-5 minutes.
Dip each prawn in the batter and deep fry until golden brown are cooked throughly.
It is best to fry the prawns in batches to allow the batter to rise fully.
Place the prawns on a tissue and serve with stir fried vegetables.

recipes.name: Sesame Chicken
instructions: In a wok heat oil fry chicken.
Fry till become brown colour.
Put soya sauce, vinegar stir fry it.
Add bell pepper, carrot and spring onion toss it well.
Also add peanut and sesame seed and now its ready to serve.

recipes.name: Tofu Chili Fry
ingredients: 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce for marinating tofu
1 green chilies cut lengthwise for garnish
instructions: Marinate the Tofu overnight in the Teriyaki sauce (make sure you leave it in refrigerator).

Next day drain the Tofu and reserve the Teriyaki sauce if any left. Mix the cornstarch with the water and put it aside. You will be doing some high heat sauteing so keep all the ingredients chopped and ready.

Heat the sesame oil in a wok or stir-fry pan and stir fry the Tofu for about 7-8 minutes. Heat should be between high and medium high. Now add the onions, followed by green peppers and stir fry for about 4 minutes. Once the onion and peppers get little sweat, add the salt, pepper, green chili sauce, soy sauce and stir.
Now add the cornstarch mixed with water and give it a good stir.
Add the reserved Teriyaki sauce and turn the heat off and add vinegar and serve hot.
Make sure you make this dish just 15 minutes before you plan to serve to retain the freshness of the dish.
